It’s automatically activated when you activate your card in the app. No additional passwords are required.Whenever you make an online payment using your Mastercard, 3D Secure confirms the transaction with you within 5 minutes via a push message. If you don't see the transaction, try some of the troubleshooting tips we've collected.If you make a purchase using your smartphone, you’ll see a pending transaction in the app. Tap on the bell icon and the push message will appear for you to confirm and finalize your purchase. Then go back to the merchant’s website. You should see a confirmation of your successful purchase within a few moments.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: Why did my online purchase fail?
content: Some reasons why your online payment failed:If you are unable to confirm the push message within 5 minutes, simply restart the payment process on the merchant's website.If you do not receive a push message, please make sure that your smartphone is connected and that push messages are enabled on your smartphone.Ensure that online payments and payments abroad are enabled in your card settings.A stable internet connection is required.If you are using an iOS device, make sure you turn off the Do Not Disturb mode.If the amount on the merchant's site is different from the one stated in the push message, this may be due to the conversion of a foreign currency into euros.Make sure that you disable any Adblockers running on your browser.Your Maestro card can’t be used for online purchases.

title: How do contactless payments work?
content: It’s not possible to deactivate contactless payments. If you’re experiencing issues with your contactless payments, keep in mind that:  To activate contactless payments, you must first use your card at an ATM or payment terminal. Transactions up to €50 don’t require a card PIN*. For amounts over €50, you’ll need to enter your card PIN. *If the merchant's payment system supports this option.Make sure your card is held directly onto an NFC-compatible payment terminal. If you remove your card too fast or didn’t hold it close enough, just try again. N26 Metal cards only have NFC on the back side of the card. Make sure to hold the back side of the card against the terminal to use NFC (using the front won’t work).If contactless is not working, please always try to use the Chip and PIN method to complete your payment.

title: Where can I use my Maestro card?
content: ℹ️ Applies to Germany, Austria, and the NetherlandsLet’s get a couple of things out of the way: your Maestro can’t be used for online purchases and it’s not an EC or Girocard (in Germany).But you can use your card in ATMs or shops where the Maestro symbol is displayed. Each ATM transaction using your Maestro is €2 (plus a fee of 1,7% of the amount for foreign currency withdrawals).You can order your Maestro card directly in the app only if you live in Germany, Austria or the Netherlands and have received a transfer of at least 100 € from one of these 3 countries.If you’re having issues using your Maestro, first check that your card settings are activated. If nothing is blocked, contact Customer Support via chat and we’ll look into it for you.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to top up my account?
content: Once you are successfully verified, you'll be able to top up your account in several ways. To do so, simply go to the N26 app and select 'Add Money' to see the available options:1. SEPA Transfer (Up to 2 business days):The transfer must be in EUR and within the SEPA zone.You will need to provide your IBAN and your name as it is written on the ID you used to create your account.If you have a Business account, please keep in mind that we do not accept company names.2. Debit or Credit Card (instant):You can choose to deposit between 20€ and 150€.The first deposit is free. The following deposits charge a fee of 3% of the deposit amount.Simply enter the card details from the sending account.Please note, prepaid cards and American Express credit cards are not accepted.3. Apple Pay or Google Pay (instant):You can choose to deposit between 20€ and 150€.The first deposit is free. The following deposits charge a fee of 3% of the deposit amount.Simply enter the card details (credit or debit) linked to the Apple Pay or Google Pay account.Please note, prepaid cards and American Express credit cards are not accepted.4. Moneybeam (instant):You can receive money from other N26 users.5. CASH26 (instant):Available in Germany, Austria and Italy.Deposit cash through our partner stores once your card is activated and with your paired device.

title: How to keep track of my daily spending?
content:
We automatically sort your transactions and display our findings in Statistics (top-right corner of the mobile app) by sorting your:Categories: We collect information on retailers and payment reasons in order to improve our categorization (such as ATM, Food & Groceries, or Shopping). For example, if you send a MoneyBeam with the reference text Lunch, we’ll put it in the Bars & Restaurants category. If you feel like a category doesn’t fit, you can just change it by selecting the transaction and choosing a category from the drop-down list.
Hashtags: We’ve also added default hashtags for transaction times (#weekend), types of transactions (#books), or locations of purchases (#berlin). You can further sort your transactions by adding your own hashtags: tap on a transaction and then the pencil icon to add tags (such as #portugal_trip or #everymonth) or remove unwanted tags.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to export a list of my transactions?
content:
Our web app(new tab) allows you to search within your transactions. You can also download a history of your transactions in CSV format. To export your transaction list:From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads
Under CSV you can select the Start Date and End Date and Download CSVYou can also sort your transactions using categories and hashtags in the app.To view and download PDFs of your (preliminary and previous) monthly balance statements:In the web app(new tab): From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads then select Bank statements.
In the mobile app: From the Home screen, tap on the three bullet points in the top-right corner of the screen and choose Balance statements.

title: What if my balance is negative?
content: Your balance can be negative as long as you’re within your Overdraft limit. If you have a negative account balance, you'll be charged an overdraft interest rate of 8.9%.Otherwise, you’ll receive an email to notify you that the authorized limit of your account has been exceeded. This means you don’t have enough funds on your account to cover future charges.Even if you haven’t used your account since you opened it, certain charges still apply (such as N26 You or N26 Metal monthly fees or express delivery costs) and have resulted in a negative balance.So you’ll need to top up your account via SEPA transfer (choose international transfer if you’re making the transfer outside of Germany) or CASH26 (if you’re in Germany or Austria). Your account will remain active for the next 60 days without doing so. At that point:You’ll receive two additional reminders (each cost €3).If you have an Overdraft: it’ll be cancelled after the second reminder and you’ll have to repay that amount immediately (or you can set up a repayment plan).If you have an N26 You, N26 Metal, or N26 Business You account: all benefits will be cancelled after 60 days and your account will turn into a standard one.If you don’t respond after 60 days, we may close your account.

title: What is the maximum I can spend?
content: The maximum daily limits (total sum within 24 hours) for card payments are:ATM withdrawals: €2.500 (or €400 in Togo, Congo, Benin, Ivory Coast, Kenya, Cameroon, Nigeria, Senegal and Algeria)In-store or online payments: €5.000You can set your own daily ATM withdrawal and payment limits within our limits directly in the app by tapping 👤 My Account then Card settings.The maximum daily limits (rolling 24 hours) for bank transfers are:MoneyBeam to N26 customers (the recipient must be visible): €1.000Outgoing transfers: €50.000Incoming transfers: No limitThe maximum monthly limit (total sum) for card transactions refers at any given point in time to the past 30 days and is €20.000*. *a monthly limit of €10.000 applies to ATM withdrawals for customers who opened their account in France. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to use Moneybeam?
content:
MoneyBeam allows you to send money to your smartphone’s contacts without knowing their bank account details. In order to send a MoneyBeam, log into the app:From the Home screen choose the Actions tab,
Tap Send Money followed by the MoneyBeam option,
Either select a contact from your phone’s contact list or add a recipient manually, using their phone number or email address. For this to work, the recipient has to be visible as an N26 customer,
Enter the amount and a reference text,
Confirm with your Confirmation PIN and the push message you receive.N26 customers will receive the transfer instantly. You can send up to €1.000 to other N26 customers within a 24-hour period.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: Why can’t I see other N26 users on MoneyBeam?
content: To carry out real-time transactions such as MoneyBeams, N26 checks your smartphone’s contact list and finds other N26 users based on saved phone numbers or emails. You can also enter someone’s contact details manually to send them a MoneyBeam.If you don’t see your friend’s name on MoneyBeam but you know they’re an N26 user, they most likely haven’t made themselves visible. Indeed you can manage your visibility as an N26 user.Most MoneyBeam transfers that fail between N26 users happen because there are multiple phone numbers or emails listed in the contact entry of a phone's address book. To avoid this, make sure you have the email and phone number your friend uses in your phone book in order to send them MoneyBeams. If the contact details you have stored don’t match, you cannot send a MoneyBeam to your friend.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How does Spaces work?
content: Set goals, create and personalize Spaces, and transfer money between them instantly. Spaces is available in the mobile and WebApp(new tab).In addition to your main account (or primary space), you can create and delete additional Spaces as often as you’d like but the number of active Spaces at any one time depends on your account type: 2 additional Spaces with an N26 or N26 Business account or up to 10 additional Spaces with N26 You, N26 Business You and N26 Metal.Your primary account statements will include all transactions sent to a space or received from one. You can download balance statements from the confirmation page.Only your primary space can be negative (if you are eligible for an overdraft). All other balances in Spaces cannot be negative, meaning you can only transfer what is available in a particular space.You can only use the balance from your primary space toward your Mastercard transactions. So consider transferring money before making a purchase if needed.Move money from one space to another by holding down on your Main Account and dragging and dropping into your space. Once the amount is confirmed the balance is updated right away.You can lock and unlock a space at anytime from your mobile and web app. You'll only need to confirm with your confirmation PIN. If a space is locked, you’ll still be able to transfer money to it. If you need to withdraw money from a locked space, you need first to unlock it.You'll be able to hide the amount within the Space from your account's total balance. Just go into your Space, tap the three dots in the top right corner and select ‘Hide space balance’.Spaces includes a feature called Rules which will help you manage your time and your finances effectively.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: What are Shared Spaces?
content: Shared Spaces is a new and easy way for N26 users to share money together. These spaces can be used for anything from splitting bills, to planning a vacation or organising a birthday gift for a friend or relative.Shared Spaces are available to N26 premium users (You / Business You / Metal), who can both create Shared Spaces and invite participants to their Space. Participants can be any N26 account holder regardless of their account type.The owner of the Shared Space owns the money inside it.The owner can invite up to 10 participants and remove participants for their space.Similar to regular Spaces, Shared Spaces have neither an IBAN nor a card attached to them.

title: How to create a Shared Space?
content:
To create a Shared Space:Create a Space and tap it in the Spaces overview.
Tap the + icon in the top right-hand corner of the page.
Read the ‘Learn more’ information and tap the ‘Invite new member’ button.
Search and select the contact list for the N26 user you wish to invite. If the person you want to invite has an N26 account but doesn't show up in the contact list, we recommend that you ask them to check if they agreed to be visible to others N26 users via the app, in the My Account section > Settings > Personal Setting > Personal Information.
If needed, enter their full name as we have it listed.
Review the information on the Grant power of attorney page (the legal screen). Once you’ve read and agreed to the T&Cs, tick the box and tap the ‘Accept power of attorney’ button.
Enter your Confirmation PIN.
Tap on the relevant participant in the list of participants.
Confirm the ‘Send Invite’ push notification on your paired mobile device.
Learn moreWhat are Shared Spaces

title: How to add or remove Shared Space participants?
content: For an owner to remove a participant from a Shared Space:In the Space overview, tap the menu indicated by the 3 dots in the top right.From the ‘Participants’ list, tap on the arrow to the right of the relevant participant’s name (iOS). Android users can just simply tap on the participant's name.Tap ‘revoke power of attorney’. Confirm the notification on the next screen and tap ‘revoke power of attorney’. Accept an invitation and join a Shared Space:In the Spaces overview, tap the Space with ‘Pending’ and the Shared Space icon. Read the Shared Space summary and continue to the Power of Attorney screen.Once you’ve read and understood the information on the Power of Attorney page (the legal screen), tick the box and tap the ‘Accept power of attorney’ button.Enter your Confirmation PIN.Confirm the ‘Accept Power of Attorney’ push notification on your paired mobile deviceYou’ll need to have enough free Space(s) to accept an invitation to a Shared Space. If not, you can only proceed if you delete other Space(s) to free up … Space.You must also not have any open Space with the same name or image as the Shared Space. You can only accept the invitation to join a Shared Space once you change the name/image of the other Space(s).To leave a Shared Space:In the Space overview, tap the menu indicated by the 3 dots in the top right.Inside the settings tap on ‘Exit Shared Space’.Confirm the notification on the next screen and tap ‘Leave the Space’.A Shared Space can be created and modified within the N26 app or WebappLearn moreWhat are Shared Spaces

title: Shared Spaces - What is a power of attorney?
content: The legal model behind Shared Spaces is called Power of Attorney (Kontovollmacht in German). Participants of a Shared Space do not have equal ownership of the account like a joint account in the traditional banking sense. After receiving Power of Attorney the participants obtain the right to act on behalf of the Owner regarding any transfer of funds within the Shared Space.The person authorizing the other to act on his behalf is called the “Owner”, this person is the only account holder. The owner must be a N26 premium account holder e.g. N26 You, N26 Metal and N26 Business You.This means that whoever created the Shared Space is its legal owner. The owner of a Shared Space: Owns all the funds within a Shared Space. Can transfer funds freely in and out of the account anytime. Can invite people to the Shared Space by granting others Power of Attorney.Can revoke the Power of Attorney of a participant at any time.Can also close a Shared Space after removing a participant. (all funds in the Shared Space will be transferred to the Owner’s Main Account)By granting a person Power of Attorney, they’ll have full access to all the money held within a Shared Space. This means that each participant can also transfer funds freely in and out of the Shared Space. N26 Bank GmbH cannot be held liable for payments covered by the Power of Attorney.Learn moreWhat are Shared Spaces

title: How to apply for an overdraft?
content: ℹ️ Available in Germany and AustriaYou can apply for an overdraft only in the N26 mobile app. You’ll know whether you qualify in real-time with no paperwork needed. You can apply for an N26 Overdraft as follows:Login the N26 mobile app.From the Homescreen, tap on the Explore-tab.Scroll down to Financial Products.Swipe to the side and tap on N26 Overdraft and follow the steps shown in the app.There you can also change the limits of your overdraft, view the interest you’ve accumulated or cancel your overdraft at any time. We offer an 8.9% p.a. interest rate deduct the interest from your account at the end of every quarter.Prefer a video over text

title: What to do if I can't repay my overdraft or loan?
content: We offer repayment plans if you can’t repay your overdraft or loan with N26 Credit. This could happen because your overdraft was cancelled or you need more than two months to repay your negative amount.Here’s how it works: chat with us and propose a detailed plan on how you’re going to pay back your overdraft or loan in instalments, such as a certain amount every month until your loan is paid off. We don’t accept offers of simply paying back the whole sum at a later date.We will then either accept, reject, or propose an alternative plan. It’s then up to you to confirm it.By the way: your account will be closed if it’s negative for an extended period of time. All closure dates are final unless you pay back your loan before this date. If not, your debt will go to a collection agency.

title: How to use Apple Pay?
content:
(Applies to Germany, Austria, France, Italy, Spain, Finland, Ireland, Iceland, Greece, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Portugal, Slovakia, Estonia, Belgium, Poland, Norway, Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, and Switzerland)Apple Pay allows you to make payments with your smartphone so you don’t have to carry your Mastercard everywhere.We’ve made a video(new tab) to help you set up your N26 Mastercard with Apple Pay.Some tips to keep in mind:Your iPhone region matches the country where your Mastercard was first shipped to (you can check your region by selecting Settings then General and Language & Region in your phone).
If you’ve lost your iPhone and aren’t able to find it again using Find My iPhone, you can always access your iCloud and remove all Apple Pay devices via the web browser on a Mac or PC. In addition, you should turn on Lost Mode to block your Mastercard for Apple Pay. Payments with your physical card will still be possible.
If your N26 Mastercard is unexpectedly removed from Apple Wallet, it may be because you have logged out of your iCloud, turned off Passcode or Touch ID, reset your device to factory settings via iTunes, or deleted all the content and settings from your device. In all cases, you can simply add your card again. Keep in mind that the card won’t be removed if you update your operating system, reset your personal device settings, or turn off Find My iPhone.
For in-store or online purchases, you must authorize your payment via Touch ID or using your passcode. If you’re using Apple Watch, authorizations are done by double-clicking on the side button. And if you’re using your Mac, authorize your payment by using Touch ID via the Touch Bar in the top-right corner of your keyboard.
If you're an N26 Metal or N26 Business You customer, it may happen that the card image displayed in your Apple Wallet shows as an N26 You card (for Metal customers) or as an N26 Business card (for Business You customers). We're working now to resolve this. Rest assured that this does not affect the usability of Apple Pay or your premium membership.
Make sure your device meets the technical requirements by visiting Apple Support(new tab):iPhone 6 or later, iPhone SE: available in apps, stores and webApple Watch paired with iPhone 5 or later: available in apps and storesiPad Pro, iPad Air 2, iPad mini 3, iPad mini 4: available in apps and webMacs introduced in 2012 or later (Macs other than the MacBook Pro with Touch Bar and Touch ID require an iPhone or Apple Watch: available in web

title: How to use Google Pay?
content: Applies to Germany, Spain, Italy, Ireland, Belgium, Slovakia, France, Denmark, Finland, Sweden, Norway, Poland and Switzerland. Google Pay is a payment method that allows you to pay with your smartphone so you don’t have to carry your Mastercard with you all the time.Google Pay is available in all shops supporting contactless (NFC) payments as well as online shops. Hold your smartphone near the contactless terminal and your payment will automatically process. When paying online, select Google Pay as the payment option. We’ll ask you to confirm your payment via push message during checkout.Some tips to keep in mind:To add your N26 Mastercard, download the Google Pay app and select Get Started to enter your card details. You’ll need Android 5.0 (Lollipop) or higher as well as an NFC-capable smartphone.Google Pay requires a screen lock. If you didn’t set it up yet, you’ll be asked to before adding your Mastercard to the Google Pay app.If you’re protecting your smartphone with a case, you might have to remove it to pay. Some payment terminals don’t recognize your phone if the case is too big.If the payment terminal asks you to present your card (again), you might have removed the smartphone too fast or didn’t hold it close enough. Just try again while keeping this in mind.

title: How to invite friends to join N26?
content: You can start inviting friends as soon as you have access to your account, in the mobile app or N26 WebApp.(new tab) To invite friends:on iOS:Log into the mobile app and tap on the Explore tab next to the + button.Tap on Refer friends.Tap on your Referral Code to copy it.Select one of the options available for sharing. Write a message to your friend or use the default then tap Send.on Android:Log into the mobile app, then go to My Account 👤 and select the gift icon.Tap on your Referral Code to copy it.Tap Tell a friend.Select one of the options available for sharing.Write a message to your friend or use the default then tap Send.Find out how you can be rewarded for your referrals with our Refer a Friend Program (available in select countries).

title: How to earn money by inviting friends to N26?
content: You can start inviting friends as soon as you have access to your account (in the app or the Web app(new tab)).To know the amount you can get per referral, simply access the Refer friends section:Log into the N26 app.From the Home screen, go to the Explore tab (mobile app) or My account 👤 (N26 Web app).Select Refer friends.Tap on your Referral Code to copy it and select one of the options available for sharing.Optionally, you can write a message to your friend or use the default. Tap Send!To receive your reward your friend must meet all our requirements:Complete their sign up using your referral link or personal code.Activate their Mastercard.Complete a first Mastercard transaction worth at least the value of the referral reward (in-store, online or ATM).Once your friend has fulfilled the requirements, you'll receive the bonus within 60 days. You can check the status of your referral bonus in the mobile app or N26 Web.In total,  you can get up to €1500 out of referrals.If your referral bonus hasn’t arrived yet, we’ve also collected a few reasons why.*The link does not expire and it can be used at any time. Personal invite codes and links should only be used for personal and non-commercial purposes. This means you can share your invite link with your personal connections via social media as long as you are the primary content owner. N26 has the right to cancel the referral program at any time.Currently, Friend referral rewards are only available for customers in Germany, Austria, Italy, France, Spain, Belgium, Luxembourg, Greece, Portugal, Ireland, the Netherlands, Finland, Estonia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Switzerland, Norway, Denmark, Poland, Iceland and Liechtenstein.You can find more information in the Refer a Friend Program T&Cs(new tab).

title: Why hasn't my referral bonus arrived?
content: Once your friend has completed all the eligibility criteria of our Refer a Friend Program, we'll verify your reward. You can always sign in to your account in the app or WebApp(new tab) to check your reward status.In most cases the referral bonus isn’t rewarded because the invited friend hasn’t made a first Mastercard transaction of 15 EUR. Please make sure to inform your friend of these requirements.Keep in mind that the reward process could take up to 60 days.N26 retains the right to withhold a reward in case of suspicious activity that violates the Terms and Conditions(new tab).Currently, Friend referral rewards are only available for customers in Germany, Austria, Italy, France, Spain, Belgium, Luxembourg, Greece, Portugal, Ireland, the Netherlands, Finland, Estonia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Switzerland, Norway, Denmark, Poland, Iceland and Liechtenstein.

title: Why are some products and services unavailable to me?
content: We collaborate with many partners. That’s why certain products and services require that you meet their requirements as well. The most common reasons why you wouldn’t be eligible for certain products:Expired or unsupported identity documents (for example, certain passports due to a lack of security features).You’re taxable in the United States. If so, you won’t be able to use certain invest or savings products. If this is not the case, contact our Customer Support via chat so we can look into your account details. You may need to switch your telephone number if it starts with a North American area code (+1).You proved your identity using PostIdent (in Germany). We’ll have to reset your account and you’ll have to prove your identity again in order to use certain products and services. If this is the case, we’ll email you about it and find a convenient time for you to do so.The product or service is not yet available in your country.

title: How to give feedback or suggest a new product?
content: We frequently send short surveys to review feedback but participation is voluntary and anonymous. For individual questions or suggestions, you can send us your feedback to ideas@n26.com(new tab). We’re always grateful if you can take a minute or two to help us get even better.And if you ever feel dissatisfied with one of our products or services, you can also file a complaint.

title: How to get push messages?
content: We send you push messages to finalize transfers (such as MoneyBeam) or to confirm a service (as with CASH26- please note this is only available in Germany, Austria, Italy). If you aren’t receiving these messages, first check that notifications are enabled for both your phone and the app. Then try some of our troubleshooting suggestions, depending on your smartphone:iOS:Delete the app and restart your smartphone. Download and install the latest version of the app from the Apple App Store and connect your smartphone again.Check whether you’re logged into your N26 app.Make sure messaging for the app has been activated in the general settings of your smartphone.Android:Delete the app and restart your smartphone. Download and install the latest version of the app from the Google Play Store and connect your smartphone again.Go to your Account settings and activate notification by tapping App settings then Notifications.Huawei and Xiaomi: go to Settings then Advanced settings and Battery settings. Then set N26 as a protected app.OnePlus: select battery optimization then the N26 app and then don't optimize.Oppo: disable battery optimization for the app and lock it in the Recent apps overview.

title: How to manage my visibility as an N26 user?
content: To grant you access to all our in-app features, N26 matches your contact data with other N26 users.In order to manage your consent to be seen as a N26 user, you can simply go to 👤 My Account in the app and selecting Settings then Personal Settings and Personal information. Then just check or uncheck the box “I agree to be identifiable for other users as N26 customer”.All of your contacts who have an N26 account set to visible will show up in the in-app contact list. Similarly, you’ll also appear in the list of other N26 customers who have your contact information. Your contact list is not permanently stored by N26 and is only used when accessing the respective N26 feature.Why do I need to be visible to other N26 users

title: Can I download the N26 app on my smartphone?
content: You can check and download the last version of the N26 app from the Apple App Store(new tab) or the Google Play Store(new tab).The minimum requirements for iPhones  (you can find your iOS version under Settings > General > Info):Model 5s or neweriOS 11 or aboveThe minimum requirements for Android (you can find your Android version under Settings > About your device):Android 6.0. or above Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to contact N26?
content:
If you want to reach out, you can open a chat with us directly within the mobile or WebApp, or from certain Support Center(new tab) articles. As an online bank we don't have branches.First of all, make sure you're up-to-date with the newest version of the app. If not, update your app in the Apple App Store(new tab) or the Google Play Store(new tab).When accessing your account from our WebApp(new tab), you can find the chat in the bottom right corner. 

Or from your paired smartphone, go to 👤 My Account then Support. Then scroll down and tap Support chat under Get in touch. 

You’ll then see your place in the queue. Keep your Mastercard close by, it's optional but you'll get faster service.Our chat is available everyday from 07:00-23:00 including Sundays and bank holidays.Please visit this article if you represent a bank or an authority and need to contact N26(new tab).

title: How to create a barcode for CASH26?
content: ℹ️ Applies to German, Austrian and Italian T&CTo create a barcode for CASH26:From the Home screen, select the Actions tab.Tap CASH26 and choose whether you want to Deposit cash or Withdraw cash.Enter the amount and your Confirmation PIN.Confirm the transaction via push message.Simply show this barcode to a partner representative and you'll either be given cash on the spot or asked for the cash you wanted to deposit. It can take up to 10 minutes until this change is reflected on your bank balance. If you delete the barcode or don't use it within 10 minutes, it’ll expire and be removed from your transaction list automatically.Prefer a video over text

title: What is CASH26?
content: ℹ️ Applies to German, Austrian and Italian T&CCASH26 allows you to withdraw or deposit cash by creating and showing a barcode at our participating stores. CASH26 is available in:11.918 REWE, Penny, dm, real, Budni, Ludwig, Eckert, ON, Adam’s, OMV, Barbarino or Rossmann locations in Germany, 2.019 participating dm, Billa, Merkur, and PENNY Austria locations in Austria 202 PAM & Panorama and 386 PENNY stores in Italy.You can find your nearest location, including opening times and directions, on the CASH26 map in the app—tap on the Actions tab in the bottom right hand corner of your mobile app and select CASH26.Withdrawals:As soon as you create a withdrawal barcode, the amount will be deducted from your balance. If you change your mind, you can delete the code and the amount will instantly return to your account.If a barcode remains unused, the amount will be returned to your account after 10 minutes.You can withdraw up to €900 (€200 per transaction) within 24 hours.Withdrawals are always free.Deposits:Deposits made with CASH26 are available on your account right away.You can deposit up to €999 (minimum €50 per deposit) within 24 hours.All CASH26 deposits will come with a fee of 1.5%.You don't need to buy anything in the store to make a withdrawal or deposit cash.Prefer a video over text

title: How to use N26 Savings?
content:
(Applies to Germany and Austria)With N26 Savings, you can open a fixed savings account with a deposit between €2.000 to €100.000 for free. You can find it in the Explore section then N26 Financial Products. You won’t be able to access the deposited amount until the plan matures (from 3 to 60 months) but you’ll earn up to 1.38% p.a. in interest during that time. After that, you’ll receive the payout directly into your N26 account.N26 Savings is possible through the close cooperation of three companies(new tab) with different partner banks. You’ll have to accept the T&Cs of all four participating parties to open an account.
For regulatory reasons, we’ll need information about your tax status. If you’re taxable in the United States, we’re currently unable to offer you our savings product.
You may be eligible for tax exemption. If so, complete our form(new tab) and open a chat with us. We'll forward your request to our partner bank.
As soon as you open your Savings account, the one-off amount will be debited from your current account. Please note that it can take up to 7 working days before your account is opened.
When the plan matures, you’ll receive the deposited amount and the interest (minus any capital gains tax if applicable) into your N26 account within 2 days.
European law requires all member states to provide legal protection of up to €100.000 per person per bank. We set an additional limit on Savings accounts in countries outside the eurozone so that this protection doesn’t fall below this limit in the event of exchange rate fluctuations.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to pay taxes on N26 Savings and N26 Invest?
content:
With N26 Savings (Germany and Austria only) and N26 Invest (Germany only), our partner banks are legally required to pass on taxes to the relevant tax authorities.We’ll have annual tax certificates ready for you in the app every April. You can find it in the Savings & Investment tab. If you need further documents for your tax return, we can provide you with an exemption order form for N26 Invest or a loss certificate.You can apply for exemptions from capital gains tax and church tax. For N26 Invest, the required documents are found in the Documents section of the Savings & Investment tab of the mobile app.
For N26 Savings, you can find the exemption form (new tab)here for Grenke Bank(new tab) and here for Greensill Bank(new tab). Chat with us and we'll ask you to send the completed document. We’ll forward your request to our partner bank.Income that is above the capital gains tax allowance is taxable in Germany. In addition to capital gains taxes, investments are subject to the solidarity surcharge and church tax.The custodian bank automatically deducts all applicable taxes from your total deposits if you are taxable in Germany. This means that the potential returns on your investment always show the net amount after tax. If you’re not taxable in Germany, you’ll receive the gross amount of your income. You’re then responsible for filing your capital gains tax in the country where you pay taxes.

title: Can I open an N26 account in my country?
content: We offer our accounts in the following countries: Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, and the US.You can open your account if you live in one of these countries and meet our requirements. Our products and services vary by country. Should you have an existing account with us and move to a country where N26 is not yet available for 18 months or more please get in touch with our Customer Support.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: Can I open an account if I live outside the eurozone?
content: If you live in Poland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Liechtenstein, Switzerland or Iceland you may open an account with us. We offer:The choice between a standard bank account or N26 Business.Accounts in €, a German IBAN, and transfers with SEPA or Moneybeam.Good currency conversion with your Mastercard debit card.Free shipping of your Mastercard or €25 for express.Foreign currency transfers with TransferWise (with the standard account).3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals in € in the EU (1.7% markup on foreign currencies withdrawals).0.1% cashback on all card payments (for Business accounts).2 Spaces in addition to the main account.A bonus for every friend you successfully invite to N26 with our Refer a Friend Program.Contactless payment with Google Pay and Apple Pay.Tips for incoming and outgoing transfers:We recommend choosing your local currency to get the best exchange rate when using your Mastercard for purchases or to withdraw cash (if not, additional fees may apply).To top up your account using your local currency, we recommend converting your currency via SEPA transfer either using TransferWise (on their website(new tab)) or using your local bank.For outgoing transfers to € accounts, simply use the app's internal SEPA transfer. For outgoing transfers to non-€ accounts, use TransferWise in the app.**Please note: TransferWise is unavailable for N26 Business accounts (only SEPA transfers in EUR).

title: How to open my N26 account?
content: You can open an account in the app (on your smartphone) or in N26 for Web(new tab) if you:are at least 18 years oldare a resident of a supported countryown a compatible smartphonehold a supported ID (eligibility depends on whether you live in Germany(new tab) or outside of Germany(new tab))don't already have an account with usare able to verify yourself in one of our supported languages: English, German, Spanish, Italian, or French.This is how the sign-up process for an N26 bank account works:After confirming your email, personal details, and shipping address, select the type of account you want. *Prove your identity and connect your smartphone to your new account.As a new signup, you'll be able to top up your account via Bank Transfer or CASH26 deposit (if you are in Germany, Austria or Italy). After a few days, you’ll receive your N26 Mastercard by post.If you'd like more information, here's how you can get in touch with us.*If you meet our minimum creditworthiness criteria, you can open an N26 account. If you don’t, we may offer you an N26 Flex account (Germany only). This decision is calculated through an automated process.We are available from 7:00 to 23:00 everyday, including Sundays and public holidays.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to prove my identity?
content: As a licensed bank, it’s important that we know who our customers are. That’s why we request our customers to prove their identity with a supported ID document when they open an account or use certain products.We would never ask you to prove your identity on behalf of other individuals or companies. We’ve gathered other tips to help you protect your identity.There are two different ways you can show us your ID, and we've also collected some troubleshooting tips for each: photo and video. The method you can choose to show us your ID depends on your nationality, your country of residence, and the type of ID you use:I live in Germany(new tab)I live in Spain(new tab)I live in Italy(new tab)I live in a different country(new tab)If your ID isn't on the list, it means we cannot offer you an account with us at the time. We take identity verification very seriously and our Customer Support will not be able to make an exception for you regarding the supported documents.But we're always adding new documents to this list so it's worth checking back to see if yours has been added.In case your residential address is in Germany and you're unable to complete your photo or video verification due to a disability, please start the registration process by entering your details and then contact our Customer Support. We're happy to assist you.Chat is available everyday from 07:00-23:00 including Sundays and bank holidays.

title: How to declare my N26 account for my taxes in France?
content: (Applies to all French residents)According to the French General Tax Code, all French residents are required to declare any bank accounts they have opened, used, or closed within the year of declaring an income. This includes your N26 bank account. To do this:In your tax return, check the box Foreign account opened, used or closed (8UU) (Compte étranger ouvert, utilisé ou fermé).Complete the Cerfa n° 3916(new tab) form and attach it to your tax return.

title: Am I liable to tax in the United States?
content:
As a licensed bank we're required to report directly to the IRS information about financial accounts held by U.S. taxpayers according to FATCA, a legislation designed by the US Department of Treasury and the U.S. Internal Revenue Service to encourage better tax compliance by preventing U.S. Persons from using foreign banks and other financial organizations in order to avoid U.S. taxation on their income and assets.You can find more information about FATCA here(new tab). In the context of FATCA, a U.S. Person is defined as, among other things:A citizen of the United States (including dual citizens)A resident in the United States, for example as a holder of a valid U.S. Green Card or as a person who passes the “Substantial Presence Test” (see below).If you're unsure as to how to determine whether you're a U.S. Person, please consult a tax advisor.“Substantial Presence Test” means:That you've been physically present in the U.S. 183 days or more in the current calendar yearORThat you have been physically present in the U.S. 183 days or more over the last three calendar years, to be calculated as follows: 

(31 days or more in the current calendar year) + (the number of days physically present in the U.S. last year) divided by 3 + (the number of days physically present in the U.S. the year before last) divided by 6. In addition, if your account shows any of the following:U.S. citizenship or U.S. residenceU.S. place of birthU.S. mailing or residence address, including U.S. PO boxesU.S. telephone numberStanding instructions to a U.S. address or an account maintained in the USwe're still obliged to treat you as a U.S. Person, unless we receive the following from you: A W-8BEN or similar agreed self-certification form andA non-U.S. passport or other government-issued identification evidencing your citizenship or nationality in a country other than the U.S.In case you were born in the US, a copy of your Certificate of Loss of Nationality of the US.

title: What does N26 do with my tax information?
content: The OECD requires certain tax information to be shared by means of the Common Reporting Standard(new tab) (ECR). To carry out our obligations, we must establish which country you’re taxable in. We do this through your tax identification or National Insurance number. We forward this information via the German Federal Tax Office to tax authorities in other countries if: You live in a ECR participating country.You have a postbox or a second registered address in another ECR participating country.When registering you gave a telephone number belonging to another ECR participating country.You have a standing order, or make regular payments, to an account located in another ECR participating country.We also forward data to the U.S. Internal Revenue Service(new tab) (IRS) according to the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act(new tab) (FATCA). We may request your Social Security Number (SSN) in order to check your tax status in the U.S. because:You are a citizen of the U.S (including dual citizenship).When registering you gave a telephone number belonging to the U.S.You were born in the U.S. (or in a U.S. embassy located abroad).You’re married to a U.S. national.You gave us an address in the U.S.You make regular payment transfers to the U.S.To update your tax identification or social security number in the N26 app:Go to  My Account and tap on Settings and Account settingsSelect Personal settings then Tax informationSelect the country in which you’re tax-liableEnter either your tax identification number or your social security numberImportant informationIn Germany, we need your Steueridentifikationsnummer (11 digits) not your Steuernummer (9 digits).If you’re not tax-liable in another country, contact us so we can confirm your tax status.In each and every case your personal data will be securely stored and only used for the fulfillment of ECR and FATCA requirements.We’re unable to advise you on your tax status. If you’re unsure of your status please discuss the matter with a tax advisor.If you’ve entered the country in which you are liable for tax but not your tax identification number, please remove the country from the list shown to you in the app, reenter the country, and enter your tax identification number again.

title: Why do I pay the church tax?
content: We’re legally required to request data relating to church tax deductions and to make the deductions where applicable. This happens every year from September 1st to October 31st.You’re entitled to appeal against the passing of information about your religious affiliation through an Erklärung zum Sperrvermerk(new tab) form. You can do this before June 30th each year. If you file an objection, your local tax office will request that you submit a church tax declaration yourself.Further information is available on the website of the German Federal Central Office for Taxation(new tab).

title: How to change my phone number, address, or other personal data?
content: It’s important to keep your personal data up to date (for example, your phone number is necessary to connect your smartphone or to send and receive MoneyBeams). Here's how you can change your information:Delivery address, password, or tax information: You can change this information yourself at any time in the app. Just go to 👤 My Account and select Settings then Personal Settings.Name and sex: Chat with us and send two forms of ID: a copy of your new ID card or passport as well as an official document of the change (a marriage licence or updated birth certificate).  We can also re-order a card with your new name once your account has been updated.Nationality: Chat with us and send a copy of your new ID card or passport.Email address: You’ll need to contact us via chat for this. We need to verify it’s really you changing your information so we can’t change any personal data over email.Phone number: You can now change your phone number yourself at any time in the app. Just go to 👤 My Account and select Settings then Personal Settings.Note: To be able to update your phone number in the app, you must use your paired device, meaning the smartphone linked to your account.

title: How to make N26 my main account?
content: We can help make N26 your main account by moving your daily banking from another account: we’ll inform any payment partners who charge recurring direct debits (like for your monthly subscriptions or bills) or who transfer money to your account (such as your employer), and we’ll explain how to set up standing orders or transfer any remaining funds over.There are three ways to switch your bank accounts over to N26:Account switching service powered by finleapTogether with our partner finleap we’re offering you a platform to easily switch your bank accounts online. It’s an automated process and completely free.To begin, use our form(new tab) and log in with your previous bank account details. Once you’ve filled in all required information, it’ll take 5 to 7 business days for us to send out all notification letters. Your payment partners may need additional time to change your bank details for future transactions.Account switching service supportYou could also inform your payment partners yourself. To do this, fill out the letter to notify your payment partners(new tab) and send it to them. You could also request the termination of your bank account(new tab) with your previous bank by filling out the form and sending it to them.This service is also free. If you need help with this process, contact our Customer Support via chat.Mandatory account switching service as per ZKG (Zahlungskontengesetz)All German licensed banks are required to offer a bank account switching service as part or §21 ZKG (Zahlungskontengesetz). To initiate this service, please download and print the account switching form(new tab) and send it to: N26 Bank GmbH Kundenservice Klosterstraße 62 10179 Berlin.Once we’ve received your request, we’ll process it within 7 business days. Your payment partners may need additional time to change your bank details for future transactions.We charge a fee of up to €20 for this service, depending on your individual request.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to download my personal data?
content: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a European regulation on data protection and privacy that went into effect on May 25th, 2018. We’ve added a data export option to the WebApp(new tab) as a response to Art. 20 GDPR. And, as with everything we do, getting your personal data you provided to us is transparent and simple, and you’re in complete control: go to 👤 My Account then Personal settings and Your personal data.The right to data portability under Art. 20 GDPR covers personal data you provided to us. Art. 20 GDPR shall enable you to easily switch the service provider in case you want to use these data to open a bank account at another bank. This is why Art. 20 GDPR requires to provide these data in a machine-readable format to you.  It's important to keep in mind that the file is to be used for data portability purposes only and your computer might not be able to read a JSON file. Also, if you can open the JSON file the data might be difficult to understand as it is not intended to be human-readable, but machine-readable. The file we provide has the only purpose of being transmitted to another bank. As a mobile bank, we know the importance of data security. For this reason we take additional security measures before you can download your data, which are described below. We do so in order to make sure that you, the account holder, is in fact the person who downloads the data.  How to download your dataYou can request to download the personal data you provided for a current or previous account with us up to 6 months after account closure date. It will come in a machine-readable format so you can share it with a third party if you choose to.Current customers:Please request your data through our web form(new tab).You will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. This link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. And please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request.Former customers:You can download personal data you provided up to 6 months after account closure date. To request this information, complete a data request form(new tab) and make sure that the information you provide correctly matches all your previous account information. You’ll need to know:the first and last name, personal ID number, and expiration date of the identification document (national ID card or passport) you used to verify the account,the registered email address of the account,the date (month and year) you created and closed your account (check your verification email).For security reasons, we have to make sure it’s really you downloading the data: if any field is inaccurate or missing, your request will not be successful.You will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. This link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. And please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request.If you want more information about the collection, use, and processing of your personal data, please visit our updated Privacy Policy (DEU(new tab)) (EU(new tab)).

title: How to close my account?
content: We are sorry to see you go, but we appreciate the time you spent with us as a customer. You have convenient options to close your N26 account.If you have a DE or ES IBANYou can use the following methods to request account closure:Option 1: Click here(new tab) to be guided through our electronic account closure process:This option is the fastest way to close your account.You will need to login to authenticate yourself.You will be guided through the process to close your account.If you cannot log in or do not want to, please follow the steps for Option 2.Option 2: Please contact us via live chat or via email to closure@n26.com(new tab) from your registered email address using our cancellation form(new tab) (the form will require the below information):A statement requesting the closure of your account on a specific date or ASAP.Your name.Your N26 IBAN.If you have a positive balance in your main account or your Spaces, we also need an IBAN within SEPA to transfer your remaining balance.If you have an IT IBANYou can use the following method to request account closure:Please send your request through live chat (click the Start New Support Chat button below) or via email to closure@n26.com(new tab) from your registered email address using our cancellation form(new tab) (the form will require the below information):A statement requesting the closure of your account on a specific date or ASAP.Your name.Your N26 IBAN.If you have a positive balance in your main account or your Spaces, we also need an IBAN within SEPA to transfer your remaining balance.A few things to consider when closing your account:For a quick account closure: if you have a positive balance, please transfer your remaining balance yourself. If you have a negative balance, top up your account.Destroy your cards by cutting them with scissors or a paper shredder. The chip, NFC antenna and the magnetic strip should all be cut into pieces and disposed of separately. (For cards that cannot be easily destroyed by cutting, please store your card in a safe place.)

title: How to file a complaint?
content:
Looking for support or have a questionIf you don't wish to make a complaint but you have questions about our products or need help with your account, we’re always happy to assist. You can email us at support@n26.com(new tab) (new tab), or just open a chat with us directly within the mobile app or WebApp, that's the fastest and simplest way to get in touch.Raising a complaintWe’re sorry you feel the need to raise a complaint, please see below for the ways you are able to do this.If you are dissatisfied with one of our products or services, you can send us an email from your registered email address* or send your complaint via post to the address to:N26 Bank GmbH – Complaint Management
Klosterstraße 62, 10179 Berlin, GermanyTo submit your complaint via email please write to the following email address beschwerden@n26.com (new tab)(new tab). Alternatively you can request to raise a complaint via our live support team and they will be happy to assist.When filing a complaint, please always include:Your full name email and home addressThe product or service you're unhappy happy withA description of your complaint and when this occurred. You can also include any supporting documentation you have in relation to your complaint We’ll contact you via email to confirm that we’ve received your complaint and then begin our investigation. In case we need more information from you, our Complaint Management department will reach out directly via email with an explanation of the information required.Once our Complaint Management department has investigated your concerns we will provide you with a final decision via email.If you are unhappy with the outcome of your complaintIf you are not satisfied with the resolution provided, you can escalate your complaint to an independent third party.For example:An arbitration body is available to you at the German Federal Bank (Deutsche Bundesbank)Or you could file a complaint with the German Federal Financial Supervisory Authority (Bundesanstalt für Finanzdienstleistungsaufsicht – BaFin) The European Commission has also set up the Online Dispute Resolution platform to help consumers dispute out of court.We are committed to constantly improving our products and services and your feedback makes this possible. Should you wish to provide us with feedback regarding anything, please write to us at ideas@n26.com(new tab) (new tab).* We can only discuss account related matters from an email address registered with the N26 account

title: What's a garnishment and what can I do?
content: A garnishment is a regulatory measure (normally effected by court) that seizes funds directly on your account as you owe them to a third party or to fiscal authorities so you cannot spend your funds in a different way. We are legally obligated to seize your account as soon as we receive a garnishment and transfer order from the creditor. Furthermore, we are obligated to transfer the garnishment amount to the creditor. We do this 4 weeks after receiving the garnishment or transfer order. Until the whole amount is paid, your account remains seized.If we receive a garnishment we'll send you an in-app message to Messages from N26 with the following information:DateName of the creditor (and name of their legal attorney)Reference numberGarnishment amountWhat can I do

title: What's an insolvency and what can I do?
content: An insolvency is a situation in which the debtor is unable to fulfil his financial obligation to the creditor(s). How this is going to affect your N26 account depends on whether you have a p-account and whether we received an insolvency application or insolvency opening. FAQWhy is my account seized although I have a clearance (unseizing) from my insolvency manager

title: What's p-account and how can I get it?
content: A p-account is a legal protection against garnishments which can be applied to any account type that we offer. If you have a German IBAN you are generally entitled to convert your N26 account to a p-account. This means that in case you have an active garnishment, you'll have a monthly allowance of normally 1178,59€ which remains accessible to you and inaccessible to the creditor on a per month basis. An active alimony garnishment can decrease that amount. Please note, however, that we need to report the conversion of you account into p-account to SCHUFA AG.You may decide to convert your N26 account to a p-account in case your N26 account has been garnished. Please note that in this case we are obligated by law to seize your account. You will simultaneously receive a detailed in-app message from us to your Messages with N26 with all information regarding your garnishment and the options available to you. We encourage you to read it carefully so you are also informed about your other options, before making a decision. In order to get a p-account, please fill out this p-account form(new tab) and sign it. You'll also find this link in the in-app message you received from us regarding your garnishment in Messages from N26. Please send the form back as a direct reply to that email or from your registered email address to support@n26.com.Please note:If your account has been garnished and you have an open credit or overdraft at the time of conversion to a p-account, we will have to cancel your overdraft and/ or credit.You're allowed to have only one p-account. Having multiple p-accounts (even at other banks) is a violation of the law and can lead to an extraordinary termination without notice of your N26 account.FAQWhat does a p-account cost

title: What is a N26 Flex account?
content: We’ll offer you an N26 Flex account if you don’t meet the minimum credit requirements to open an N26 bank account:We charge a monthly account management fee of €6. We debit this fee directly from the account. The first fee is deducted 10 days after the account is opened. After that we’ll deduct the amount every month on sign-up date. Make sure you have sufficient funds in your account to cover these payments in order to avoid overdraft fees.Cash withdrawals at ATMs or from one of our 9.000 CASH26 retailer partners are €2 each. Both are debited immediately.N26 Flex can’t be combined with N26 Business, N26 Business You, N26 You, or N26 Metal.

title: How to get a Basiskonto?
content:
Download the request form(new tab) and complete it with a handwritten signature.In the request form you’ll find an attached coupon for legitimation at Deutsche Post AG. Go to your nearest Deutsch Post office, in order to prove your identity with the coupon.In addition, send us the completed and signed request via post to:
N26 Bank GmbH
Stw.: ZKG Basiskonto
Klosterstraße 62
10179 Berlin, DeutschlandOnce we’ve received your form and determined whether we can open a Basiskonto for you, we’ll send you an email including the contract and the T&Cs(new tab).You then send us your signed contract via post to our address.As soon as we receive the contract we’ll open a Basiskonto for you. You’ll receive a notification about the delivery of your card and access to your account.

title: Why can’t I get a Basiskonto?
content: Under some circumstances, N26 is allowed to reject your Basiskonto request. That’s the case if you:Live outside of a supported country.Already have an N26 bank account or another bank account in Germany and can use it to its full extent. Were convicted of a crime against the bank, its employees, or its customers within the past 3 years. Have already maintained a Basiskonto at N26 in the past that was closed due to prohibited usage or a negative balance. You didn’t meet minimum requirements in accordance to the Money Laundering Act and the Credit Services Act.

title: Who can get a Basiskonto?
content: You can open a free N26 bank account through our website or by downloading our app. The German Payment Accounts Act (Zahlungskontengesetz or ZKG) also gives all consumers who legally reside in the European Union the right to hold a basic payment account. This applies to those who live in a supported country.The N26 Basiskonto comes with a monthly 6€ account management fee. You can find all other fees in our pricing lists. If you don’t have a bank account at N26 or at any other financial institution in Germany yet, you can apply. Under some circumstances, N26 is allowed to reject your request.  Please note that some products and services such as N26 Overdraft, N26 Credit, N26 You, or N26 Metal are not accessible with an N26 Basiskonto.

title: How much does an N26 account cost?
content: An N26 bank account is free.*Additional charges may apply, depending on your region:Pricing in Germany(new tab)Pricing in Austria(new tab)Pricing in France(new tab)Pricing in Spain(new tab)Pricing in Italy(new tab)Pricing in the rest of Europe(new tab)*If we’re not able to offer you an N26 account based on our minimum requirements(new tab), you may be able to open an N26 Flex account.

title: What are the benefits of N26 Metal?
content:
ℹ️ Available in Germany, Austria, France, Spain, Italy, Belgium, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Slovakia, Poland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein.Upgrade to N26 Metal and you’ll receive 10 additional Spaces, dedicated Customer Support, access to exclusive partner offerings(new tab), as well as the N26 Metal insurance package, provided by Allianz Global Assistance*, which covers a broad range of personal and financial benefits such as:Travel insurance. Reimbursement of medical expenses abroad, for travel cancellations after a medical emergency, expenses incurred during a flight delay of more than 4 hours, expenses in the event of a checked-in luggage delay of more than 6 hours, and medical repatriation expenses.
Snow and mountain rescue. Get covered for search, rescue, first transportation costs, and medical expenses in the event of accidents during a trip in the mountains.
Mobile phone theft insurance. Compensation if your smartphone is stolen in your home country or abroad.
Travel car rental. Get vehicle coverage in the event of damage or theft.Extra card. You can purchase an extra N26 Metal card for a one-off fee of 10€ through your N26 app. Keep these in mind when considering N26 Metal(new tab):N26 Metal features an NFC-enabled Mastercard with a metal core in your choice of charcoal black, quartz rose, or slate grey.If you’re a new customer, the first fee will be deducted 15 days after you prove your identity. From then on, you’ll be charged your monthly fee on your sign-up date.Please top up your account right after completing the sign up with at least the amount of the monthly Metal fee in order to receive the card If you upgrade to N26 Metal, the monthly fee of €16,90 will be deducted directly from your N26 account every month starting on the date of your upgrade.If you were previously an N26 You member, all purchases and travel booked using your N26 You Mastercard will remain insured.The minimum membership is one year. Your contract automatically renews if you do not cancel your membership at least 4 weeks before the contract expires.You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 14€ through your N26 app. *Allianz Global Assistance Europe trade name of AWP P&C S.A. - Dutch branch, and member of the Allianz Group.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to upgrade to Metal?
content: ℹ️ Available in Germany, Austria, France, Spain, Italy, Belgium, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Poland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Iceland, Liechtenstein.N26 Metal is available during initial sign-up, or by upgrading in the mobile app if you already have a N26 bank account or a N26 You membership. To upgrade to N26 Metal from the mobile app, simply go to the Explore tab and select Get N26 Metal. and choose between a Charcoal Black, Quartz Rose, or Slate Grey card.Check the conditions of the delivery and accept the N26 Metal T&Cs(new tab). Once you confirm your request by entering your Confirmation PIN, your new card will be on the way.Standard deliveries take up to 10 business days.The membership fee of €16,90 will be deducted directly from your account every month on the date of your upgrade.The minimum contract period for the N26 Metal membership is one year. Your membership will automatically renew unless you cancel it up to four weeks before the contract ends.All purchases and travel booked using your N26 You Mastercard will remain insured.If you’re already a N26 You member, you don’t have to pay the fees for the N26 You membership on top.You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 14€ through your N26 app. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: What are the benefits of N26 You?
content:
Once you upgrade to N26 You, you’ll receive 10 additional Spaces and the option to choose one of our five new card colours: Rhubarb, Ocean, Sand, Aqua, and Slate. N26 You customers are also covered under the premium account's insurance package provided by Allianz Global Assistance*, which includes a broad range of personal and financial benefits such as:Travel insurance: Reimbursement of medical expenses abroad, for travel cancellations after a medical emergency, expenses incurred during a flight delay of more than 4 hours, expenses in the event of a checked-in luggage delay of more than 6 hours, and medical repatriation expenses.
Snow and mountain rescue. Get covered for search, rescue, first transportation costs, and medical expenses in the event of accidents during a trip in the mountains.Car, bike and scooter sharing. Coverage for any damage or theft of vehicles rented from ride-sharing companies.Extra card. You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 10€ through your N26 app (available in Germany, Spain, Austria, Italy). If you’re an N26 You customer, or if you want to upgrade to N26 You, you’ll have the possibility to choose one of our five new colors when ordering a new card: Keep these in mind when considering N26 You(new tab):The N26 You Mastercard has no embossing: the card details, including the number, CVV code, and 10-digit token are printed on the back.If you upgrade to N26 You, the monthly fee of €9,90 will be deducted directly from your N26 account every month starting on the date of your upgrade. If you’re a new customer, the first fee will be deducted 15 days after you prove your identity. From then on, you’ll be charged your monthly fee on your sign-up date. Meaning that, if you opened your account at the end of the month, the first two  monthly fees will be charged the following month.The minimum membership is one year. Your contract automatically renews if you don’t cancel your membership at least 4 weeks before the contract expires.*Allianz Global Assistance Europe trade name of AWP P&C S.A. - Dutch branch, and member of the Allianz Group.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to upgrade to N26 You?
content: ℹ️ Applies to Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Poland, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden.You can upgrade to N26 You during initial sign-up, or by upgrading in the mobile app if you have a standard N26 bank account. To upgrade to N26 You in the mobile app, simply go to the Explore tab and select Get N26 You. You can choose between one of our five new colours when ordering a new card: Rhubarb, Ocean, Sand, Aqua, and Slate.Then choose your preferred delivery method, accept the N26 You T&C's(new tab) and your new card will be on the way. Standard deliveries take up to 10 business days whereas express deliveries take 3 business days. The membership fee of €9,90 will be deducted directly from your account every month on the date of your upgrade.The minimum contract period for the N26 You membership is one year. Your membership will automatically renew unless you cancel it up to four weeks before the contract ends. You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 14€ through your N26 app.

title: How to cancel my N26 You or N26 Metal membership?
content: N26 You(new tab) or N26 Metal(new tab) contracts have a term of one year. This contract automatically renews for another year unless you cancel it. In this article you will find the difference between revocation, cancellation of the membership and cancellation of the renewal of your membership. You have 3 options:Revoke your membership within the 14-day revocation periodCancel your membership at any time up to 1 month before your contract endsStop your membership’s renewal up to 1 month before it expiresFind in details how to do so below. RevocationYou can revoke your membership within the 14-day revocation period. Simply open a chat with us and we'll assist you from there.Keep in mind that if you cancel your contract before it ends, you won’t be able to sign up for the same membership plan in the future.Cancel your membership at any time*If you want to terminate your membership at any time up to *1 month before your contract ends and after the 14-day revocation period, please contact us.If you choose this option all your N26 You or N26 Metal benefits will end, which includes your insurance coverage.Stop the renewal of your membership You have up to 4 weeks before your membership expires to cancel the renewal of your N26 You or N26 Metal membership. To do so:Log into the mobile app and go to 👤 My AccountSelect N26 You/MetalTap Membership details followed by Cancel Membership you can also see your membership expiration date hereConfirm the cancellation via the push message we send youYou can continue to use your N26 You or N26 Metal Mastercard fully until your membership expires. That means you’ll keep your insurance coverage as long as you’re still required to pay your membership fee. After that, your Mastercard will work like a standard card without the benefits. We’ll send you a standard card before your contract ends. No need to contact us about it.We’ll notify you of the renewal via email 8 weeks before your anniversary date.If you want to definitely close your account, visit our article How to close my N26 account.

title: How to report an insurance claim?
content: Your N26 You(new tab) and N26 Metal(new tab) membership includes a wide range of insurance benefits, covered by our partner Allianz Global Assistance Europe.*To report a claim, log into your app, go to 👤 My Account and select N26 You/Metal, then select Make a claim.There you'll find:A guide to submit your claim (for example, flight or luggage delay, extended warranty, or travel cancellation)Your account and contract information, including your N26 You or N26 Metal IDThe option to contact Allianz directly in the case of a medical emergencyFor emergencies, please have the following information ready:The full address and telephone number of your current locationNames of all official contacts (doctors, hospitals, and/or police)An exact description of the situation*Allianz Global Assistance Europe is a trading name of AWP P&C S.A. - Dutch branch, and a member of the Allianz Group.

title: How does N26 Business work?
content: ℹ️ Applies to Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.It’s not yet possible to switch between accounts so it’s important to know if N26 Business is right for you:The N26 Business account is designed for self-employed and freelance users doing business under their own name. That means you can’t have your company’s name on the account or card.The N26 Business Mastercard is intended for business use only. You receive 0.1% cashback every month on all payments made using the card. It’s currently not possible to have two separate N26 accounts at the same time so if you also need a card for private expenses, we recommend ordering a Maestro card (it’s available in Germany, Austria, and the Netherlands).As with the N26 bank account, the account is free and we cover certain cash withdrawals as part of our Fair Use Policy. Unlike other accounts, transfers in foreign currencies aren’t possible with N26 Business within the app. You can visit Transferwise(new tab) for this.Business to business (B2B) payments are not supported with a N26 Business account. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How does N26 Business You work?
content: ℹ️ Applies to Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, and Sweden.It’s not yet possible to switch between private and business accounts so it’s important to know if N26 Business You is right for you:The N26 Business You account is designed for self-employed and freelance users doing business under their own name. That means you can’t have your company’s name on the account or card. The account is €9,90 per month. The minimum membership is one year. Your contract automatically renews if you do not cancel your membership(new tab) at least 4 weeks before the contract expires.  The premium account includes: Allianz Insurance Package including coverage for business purposes and fee-free foreign currency ATM withdrawals, The N26 Business Mastercard is intended for business use only. You receive 0.1% cashback every month on all payments made using the card. It’s currently not possible to have two separate N26 accounts at the same time so if you also need a card for private expenses, we recommend ordering a Maestro card (it’s available in Germany and Austria, and the Netherlands).Transfers in foreign currencies aren’t possible with N26 Business You.You can sign-up during registration or if you’re already an N26 Business user.You can purchase an extra N26 Business You card for a one-off fee of 10€ through your N26 app. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How does N26 Business Metal work?
content: ℹ️ Applies to Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, and Sweden.It’s not yet possible to switch between private and business accounts so it’s important to know if N26 Business Metal is right for you:The N26 Business Metal account is designed for self-employed and freelance users doing business under their own name. That means you can’t have your company’s name on the account or card. The account is €16,90 per month. The minimum membership is one year. Your contract automatically renews if you do not cancel your membership(new tab) at least 4 weeks before the contract expires.  The premium account includes: Allianz Insurance Package including coverage for business purposes and fee-free foreign currency ATM withdrawals, The N26 Business Mastercard is intended for business use only. You receive 0.5% cashback every month on all payments made using the card. It’s currently not possible to have two separate N26 accounts at the same time so if you also need a card for private expenses, we recommend ordering a Maestro card (it’s available in Germany and Austria, and the Netherlands).Transfers in foreign currencies aren’t possible with N26 Business Metal.You can sign-up during registration or if you’re already an N26 Business user.You can purchase an extra N26 Business Metal card for a one-off fee of 10€ through your N26 app. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: When will my card arrive?
content: Standard delivery takes up to 15 business days and is free of charge if it's your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership. To stay up-to-date on the delivery progress simply go to the home screen of your N26 mobile app.Express delivery takes up to 3 working days and comes with an additional fee of 20€. In addition to the banner on the home screen of your N26 mobile app, you will also receive an email with a tracking link to stay up-to-date on the progress of your card delivery. Learn more in our dedicated article about express delivery.Please wait until the estimated delivery time has elapsed before taking further action.
