Once in contact with one of our agents, please thoroughly explain the situation to us.  Every detail here is important. 
Please be assured that we’ll take all necessary measures to assist you in this situation. In addition to our legal obligations for fraud prevention, and in order to continually improve our security safeguards, we have a dedicated team who analyzes each fraud case individually. The fraud cases themselves are often relatively complicated and have to be dealt with in detail. Depending on the complexity, this can take a few days, but in some cases it can take several weeks.Finally, if you have evidence or strong feelings that the account might have been hacked, we recommend that you file a police report as well.To learn more about how we protect your account in case of fraud, visit our blog article(new tab). Visit our page about Security at N26(new tab) to discover our commitment to protect your funds and your account.Chat is available everyday from 07:00-23:00 including Sundays and bank holidays.If you do not have access to your N26 mobile app or your N26 webapp login, you can also request to block your card or account by calling us at +44 2035 107126 or +49 303 6428 6881 (both lines in English) .

title: Can N26 close my account?
content: In short: yes.We can close your account in 3 ways (with 2 months notice, 14 days notice, or immediately). These cancellations are final: our Customer Support can’t provide any information about the background of individual cancellations nor can they reverse the decision. You’re also able to terminate your business relationship with us at any time, immediately, and without a reason.2 months notice:We have the right to terminate any business relationship with 2 months notice without a cause (see section 19 (1) of our T&Cs(new tab) or § 675h of the German Civil Code).14 days notice:We can also terminate any business relationship with 14 days notice (see section 19 (3) of our T&Cs(new tab)) if reasonable cause is given due to the breach of contractual duties. These include:Using a personal account for business purposes. According to our T&Cs, a private account may only be used for personal use. Any credit transfers that relate to professional fees for provided services and/or sold products are considered business transactions. If you’d like to use your account for this purpose, please sign up for an N26 Business, N26 Business You or N26 Business Metal account.Providing incorrect or insufficient information for a routine background check. We’re a bank so we sometimes run checks on transactions. If you don’t provide correct and/or sufficient information about the transaction in question, we have the right to terminate the business relationship in order to be compliant with German financial regulations.Displaying abusive behaviour towards N26 employees. We don’t tolerate abusive behaviour towards our employees. The threat of physical harm or general abusive behaviour may be considered a criminal offense according to German law and will be reported to the respective authority without exception.Immediate cancellationWe may also terminate any business relationship on an extraordinary basis (see section 19 (3) of our T&Cs(new tab)). That means: at any time, without prior notice, and without a cancellation period when there is reasonable cause for such termination. These include:Providing incorrect statements to N26 about your financial situation, especially when you apply for a credit.Failure to repay your loan or any debt toward N26.Failure to comply with N26's requests about your loan (see provision or increase of security, section 13 (2) of our T&C's(new tab)).

title: How to protect my identity?
content: To protect and help avoid the misuse of your personal data, please keep in mind that:We will never ask you to prove your identity on behalf of other individuals or companies. This includes verifications for apartment rental contracts, lines of credit, or job offers (including jobs with N26). Only complete the verification process if you want to open an N26 bank account for yourself.As the account owner, only you should create and have access to your login details. Never create an N26 bank account with a predefined email address and password. If you use login credentials that were given to you, these credentials may be used to reach your personal and legal information. Also, never log into an N26 account that is not yours.Do not send your ID or passport to unknown or unverified recipients.We may ask for certain documents when your transaction is subject to a routine check. Only send valid documentation to verified N26 email accounts.We will never ask for your username, password, or PIN codes outside the N26 app. Never provide this information in an external website or app, even if it looks N26-related.If you ever feel in doubt, have received a suspicious request from a third party, or think your N26 login may be compromised, please do not hesitate to contact us.

title: How to connect or disconnect my smartphone to my account?
content: In order to use your N26 account, you need a smartphone : either an iPhone (5s or newer, at least iOS 11) or an Android (6.0 or newer - we do not support the customized versions of Amazon Fire and Oxygen OS). Only one device can be paired per account.You'll need to pair and/or unpair your smartphone when you first create an account or if you get a new phone number or device.To pair your smartphone with your account, simply open the app on your smartphone. You will be asked to confirm your mobile phone number.Enter the 4-digit code we send you via SMS and your phone is paired. If you want to pair a new device, you must unpair your old device for security reasons. You can do this in 👤 My Account (mobile app) or in the Web app(new tab) under 👤 My Account then Security Settings if you don’t have access to your smartphone anymore. You’ll receive an email from us with further instructions.If you log into your N26 account with a new device, you'll receive two codes – a Login SMS code with 6 digits and Pairing SMS code with 4 digits. You'll need the Login code to access your account and the Pairing code for pairing your device.

title: How to change my confirmation PIN?
content: You can change your Confirmation PIN at any time in the app:Go to 👤 My Account then: Settings and Security (mobile app) or Security Settings (WebApp(new tab))Select Change Confirmation PINEnter the 10-digit token number on your MastercardCreate and confirm your new Confirmation PINIf you enter your Confirmation PIN incorrectly 6 times, you'll need to reset it before trying again.For security reasons, your PIN can’t contain parts of your date of birth or your address, repeated numbers (such as 1111, 111, or 11), or sequences (such as 1234 or 4321). If the PIN you’ve chosen is not accepted, please try again using a different one.Prefer a video over text

title: Why didn't I receive my pairing code via SMS?
content: A pairing code is required to connect your smartphone to your account. If you didn’t receive this code via SMS for whatever reason, you can request a new one up to five times in the mobile app. Please wait 30 seconds before requesting a new one. If all five codes are requested and pairing is still unsuccessful, then for security reasons you’ll be blocked from making further requests for 24 hours. If this happens, you can either wait or contact our Customer Support via chat - who would be happy to help you.If your country code is outside of the EU, it’s likely that you’ll need to contact us to receive a pairing code.

title: How to create a password?
content: If you forgot your password or want to change it, select Forgot

title: How to log in with Two Factor Authentication?
content: What is Two-Factor Authentication

title: How to get my money back in case of fraud?
content: If you don’t recognize a transaction or you’re sure you didn’t authorize it, blocking your card won’t be enough. In these cases you should immediately:Request new card(new tab) and indicate that the old one has been stolen. Please tear up the card by cutting it with scissors, for example. Both the chip, the NFC antenna and the magnetic stripe must be cut into pieces.Then fill out the dispute form(new tab). From there we will do everything we can to get your money back.You can continue using your account for bank transfers until your new card arrives. If you're in Germany or Austria, you can also use CASH26 for cash withdrawals.You should keep in mind that changes in the final amount debited from your account don't necessarily indicate fraud.

title: Why was I charged twice?
content: We offer you banking in real-time. This means you’re able to see the processes going on behind your account that you otherwise wouldn’t see. There are two main transaction types that take place during an in-store or online purchase:Authorizations. A block or reserved amount made by a retailer or merchant. This includes anything from your morning cup of coffee to hotel or car rental bookings (including security deposits).Presentments. The actual amount that is deducted from your account. Again, that cup of coffee is finally cleared from your account or you can get your security deposit back once that hotel room or car is returned safe and sound.Once an authorization has been confirmed, we can’t cancel or reverse it. At that point, a few things can happen to your authorization: it turns into a presentment, it's rejected, or it expires (and automatically returns to your account after 12 days at the latest. Car rental deposits may need up to 30 days to return to your account). Keep in mind:Sometimes you’ll see both the authorization and the presentment if they become disconnected or due to technical issues at the payment terminal. Eventually the authorization will expire. If it doesn’t, we can help get your money back.Verification authorizations (usually very small amounts) are used to check whether your card is active. This money will return to your account.The amount of an authorization can differ from the final presentment for a variety of reasons.

title: How to dispute a transaction?
content: Is there a card transaction on your N26 monthly statement that you did not make

title: How does N26 protect my money?
content: German deposit protection(new tab) insures all deposits up to €100.000 held in the member states of the European Union. As the holder of a banking license, N26 Bank must comply with the rules of the German financial regulatory authority.

title: Where does N26 invest my money?
content: We strive to provide our clients' deposits for loans to our customers (provided that they have the appropriate credit rating). For the liquidity not required in the customer business, our investment strategy is low in risk.We invest our customers' money at short notice with the Deutsche Bundesbank and other European banks in the eurozone with only good risk classes. And we refinance public-law customers mainly in Germany (cities and municipalities) and invest in euro government bonds.We're not a trading book institute. That is: we do not trade for short-term profit.And we don't engage in speculation, whether on food, foreign exchange, bitcoins or other asset classes.

title: Why does N26 do checks on transactions?
content:
We have the responsibility to run routine checks on accounts and transactions in order to ensure your account’s security (see GwG § 10(new tab)). These checks are automatically initiated by our systems. As a result, we may ask you to provide some documents. If you receive such a request, please send the requested documents via Messages from N26. There are no exceptions or evasion for such checks. This practice is a standard banking procedure and ensures the safety of our customers. Both the process and the result are confidential and handled internally. Here are some tips to speed up the process:The document that we need you to provide will be exactly named in the message you’ll receive from N26. You can send us scanned documents, pictures, or screenshots, as long as the original content of the document is easily readable. Please make sure to also provide a detailed description. Be precise in your answers, details, and documents. After we receive your required proof and description, we will let you know if your reply fulfills our check. In a few cases, we might ask for further clarification which could prolong the process.Reply as soon as possible, always before the deadline stated in the message you received from N26. Use that email to reply and send attachments. Our Customer Support doesn’t have any additional information on this subject.You must provide valid documentation depending on your situation.
 Find here some examples:You've received financial help from your family to complete projects or have inherited land or money from deceased relatives.
A granting/loan contract, an official document of inheritance, or an official document of the source of the loan (such as the sales documents of a sold property to finance the loan or bank statements of granting relatives).You've sold a property or your shares on the stock market.
The contract showing the agreed transactions or the official notarial documentation of the transfer of property.You've received or sent money to pay bills or buy a product.
Documents showing the balance statements confirming the source of this money or documents showing the use of the money and its purpose.You've received a final payout from your previous employer.
Documents proving the end of your employment, detailing the payment and/or a bank statement from your previous employer.

title: Can I open an N26 account in my country?
content: We offer our accounts in the following countries: Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, and the US.You can open your account if you live in one of these countries and meet our requirements. Our products and services vary by country. Should you have an existing account with us and move to a country where N26 is not yet available for 18 months or more please get in touch with our Customer Support.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: Can I open an account if I live outside the eurozone?
content: If you live in Poland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Liechtenstein, Switzerland or Iceland you may open an account with us. We offer:The choice between a standard bank account or N26 Business.Accounts in €, a German IBAN, and transfers with SEPA or Moneybeam.Good currency conversion with your Mastercard debit card.Free shipping of your Mastercard or €25 for express.Foreign currency transfers with TransferWise (with the standard account).3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals in € in the EU (1.7% markup on foreign currencies withdrawals).0.1% cashback on all card payments (for Business accounts).2 Spaces in addition to the main account.A bonus for every friend you successfully invite to N26 with our Refer a Friend Program.Contactless payment with Google Pay and Apple Pay.Tips for incoming and outgoing transfers:We recommend choosing your local currency to get the best exchange rate when using your Mastercard for purchases or to withdraw cash (if not, additional fees may apply).To top up your account using your local currency, we recommend converting your currency via SEPA transfer either using TransferWise (on their website(new tab)) or using your local bank.For outgoing transfers to € accounts, simply use the app's internal SEPA transfer. For outgoing transfers to non-€ accounts, use TransferWise in the app.**Please note: TransferWise is unavailable for N26 Business accounts (only SEPA transfers in EUR).

title: How to open my N26 account?
content: You can open an account in the app (on your smartphone) or in N26 for Web(new tab) if you:are at least 18 years oldare a resident of a supported countryown a compatible smartphonehold a supported ID (eligibility depends on whether you live in Germany(new tab) or outside of Germany(new tab))don't already have an account with usare able to verify yourself in one of our supported languages: English, German, Spanish, Italian, or French.This is how the sign-up process for an N26 bank account works:After confirming your email, personal details, and shipping address, select the type of account you want. *Prove your identity and connect your smartphone to your new account.As a new signup, you'll be able to top up your account via Bank Transfer or CASH26 deposit (if you are in Germany, Austria or Italy). After a few days, you’ll receive your N26 Mastercard by post.If you'd like more information, here's how you can get in touch with us.*If you meet our minimum creditworthiness criteria, you can open an N26 account. If you don’t, we may offer you an N26 Flex account (Germany only). This decision is calculated through an automated process.We are available from 7:00 to 23:00 everyday, including Sundays and public holidays.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: Why isn’t my photo verification working?
content: ℹ️ Applies to all regions except GermanyFirst, geolocation must be enabled. Then review the guide(new tab) we’ve created to help you take the best pictures.Most photo verifications fail due to bad picture quality.Complete the process in a bright environment and use a phone with a good camera.If you're using an Android, ensure a proper auto focus.Enable or disable your flash according to the surrounding light (only with Android)Take your selfie with your id document at eye level (the camera and your document should be at the same height as your eyes).Make sure you’re the only person in the photo.Check your document.We only accept photos of your original ID (photocopies or screenshots are not permitted).Keep your document on a flat surface and make sure your document is fully visible and the information on it is readable.We only accept national IDs and passports.Make sure your document isn't damaged in any way.If you take a picture of your ID and a selfie and the first attempt doesn’t go through, you can just start over again.As soon as your verification is complete, we’ll send you your N26 Mastercard. Deliveries take up to 10 days.Chat is available Monday to Sunday from 07:00-23:00.

title: How to prove my identity?
content: As a licensed bank, it’s important that we know who our customers are. That’s why we request our customers to prove their identity with a supported ID document when they open an account or use certain products.We would never ask you to prove your identity on behalf of other individuals or companies. We’ve gathered other tips to help you protect your identity.There are two different ways you can show us your ID, and we've also collected some troubleshooting tips for each: photo and video. The method you can choose to show us your ID depends on your nationality, your country of residence, and the type of ID you use:I live in Germany(new tab)I live in Spain(new tab)I live in Italy(new tab)I live in a different country(new tab)If your ID isn't on the list, it means we cannot offer you an account with us at the time. We take identity verification very seriously and our Customer Support will not be able to make an exception for you regarding the supported documents.But we're always adding new documents to this list so it's worth checking back to see if yours has been added.In case your residential address is in Germany and you're unable to complete your photo or video verification due to a disability, please start the registration process by entering your details and then contact our Customer Support. We're happy to assist you.Chat is available everyday from 07:00-23:00 including Sundays and bank holidays.

title: How to declare my N26 account for my taxes in France?
content: (Applies to all French residents)According to the French General Tax Code, all French residents are required to declare any bank accounts they have opened, used, or closed within the year of declaring an income. This includes your N26 bank account. To do this:In your tax return, check the box Foreign account opened, used or closed (8UU) (Compte étranger ouvert, utilisé ou fermé).Complete the Cerfa n° 3916(new tab) form and attach it to your tax return.

title: Am I liable to tax in the United States?
content:
As a licensed bank we're required to report directly to the IRS information about financial accounts held by U.S. taxpayers according to FATCA, a legislation designed by the US Department of Treasury and the U.S. Internal Revenue Service to encourage better tax compliance by preventing U.S. Persons from using foreign banks and other financial organizations in order to avoid U.S. taxation on their income and assets.You can find more information about FATCA here(new tab). In the context of FATCA, a U.S. Person is defined as, among other things:A citizen of the United States (including dual citizens)A resident in the United States, for example as a holder of a valid U.S. Green Card or as a person who passes the “Substantial Presence Test” (see below).If you're unsure as to how to determine whether you're a U.S. Person, please consult a tax advisor.“Substantial Presence Test” means:That you've been physically present in the U.S. 183 days or more in the current calendar yearORThat you have been physically present in the U.S. 183 days or more over the last three calendar years, to be calculated as follows: 

(31 days or more in the current calendar year) + (the number of days physically present in the U.S. last year) divided by 3 + (the number of days physically present in the U.S. the year before last) divided by 6. In addition, if your account shows any of the following:U.S. citizenship or U.S. residenceU.S. place of birthU.S. mailing or residence address, including U.S. PO boxesU.S. telephone numberStanding instructions to a U.S. address or an account maintained in the USwe're still obliged to treat you as a U.S. Person, unless we receive the following from you: A W-8BEN or similar agreed self-certification form andA non-U.S. passport or other government-issued identification evidencing your citizenship or nationality in a country other than the U.S.In case you were born in the US, a copy of your Certificate of Loss of Nationality of the US.

title: What does N26 do with my tax information?
content: The OECD requires certain tax information to be shared by means of the Common Reporting Standard(new tab) (ECR). To carry out our obligations, we must establish which country you’re taxable in. We do this through your tax identification or National Insurance number. We forward this information via the German Federal Tax Office to tax authorities in other countries if: You live in a ECR participating country.You have a postbox or a second registered address in another ECR participating country.When registering you gave a telephone number belonging to another ECR participating country.You have a standing order, or make regular payments, to an account located in another ECR participating country.We also forward data to the U.S. Internal Revenue Service(new tab) (IRS) according to the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act(new tab) (FATCA). We may request your Social Security Number (SSN) in order to check your tax status in the U.S. because:You are a citizen of the U.S (including dual citizenship).When registering you gave a telephone number belonging to the U.S.You were born in the U.S. (or in a U.S. embassy located abroad).You’re married to a U.S. national.You gave us an address in the U.S.You make regular payment transfers to the U.S.To update your tax identification or social security number in the N26 app:Go to  My Account and tap on Settings and Account settingsSelect Personal settings then Tax informationSelect the country in which you’re tax-liableEnter either your tax identification number or your social security numberImportant informationIn Germany, we need your Steueridentifikationsnummer (11 digits) not your Steuernummer (9 digits).If you’re not tax-liable in another country, contact us so we can confirm your tax status.In each and every case your personal data will be securely stored and only used for the fulfillment of ECR and FATCA requirements.We’re unable to advise you on your tax status. If you’re unsure of your status please discuss the matter with a tax advisor.If you’ve entered the country in which you are liable for tax but not your tax identification number, please remove the country from the list shown to you in the app, reenter the country, and enter your tax identification number again.

title: How to change my phone number, address, or other personal data?
content: It’s important to keep your personal data up to date (for example, your phone number is necessary to connect your smartphone or to send and receive MoneyBeams). Here's how you can change your information:Delivery address, password, or tax information: You can change this information yourself at any time in the app. Just go to 👤 My Account and select Settings then Personal Settings.Name and sex: Chat with us and send two forms of ID: a copy of your new ID card or passport as well as an official document of the change (a marriage licence or updated birth certificate).  We can also re-order a card with your new name once your account has been updated.Nationality: Chat with us and send a copy of your new ID card or passport.Email address: You’ll need to contact us via chat for this. We need to verify it’s really you changing your information so we can’t change any personal data over email.Phone number: You can now change your phone number yourself at any time in the app. Just go to 👤 My Account and select Settings then Personal Settings.Note: To be able to update your phone number in the app, you must use your paired device, meaning the smartphone linked to your account.

title: How to download my personal data?
content: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a European regulation on data protection and privacy that went into effect on May 25th, 2018. We’ve added a data export option to the WebApp(new tab) as a response to Art. 20 GDPR. And, as with everything we do, getting your personal data you provided to us is transparent and simple, and you’re in complete control: go to 👤 My Account then Personal settings and Your personal data.The right to data portability under Art. 20 GDPR covers personal data you provided to us. Art. 20 GDPR shall enable you to easily switch the service provider in case you want to use these data to open a bank account at another bank. This is why Art. 20 GDPR requires to provide these data in a machine-readable format to you.  It's important to keep in mind that the file is to be used for data portability purposes only and your computer might not be able to read a JSON file. Also, if you can open the JSON file the data might be difficult to understand as it is not intended to be human-readable, but machine-readable. The file we provide has the only purpose of being transmitted to another bank. As a mobile bank, we know the importance of data security. For this reason we take additional security measures before you can download your data, which are described below. We do so in order to make sure that you, the account holder, is in fact the person who downloads the data.  How to download your dataYou can request to download the personal data you provided for a current or previous account with us up to 6 months after account closure date. It will come in a machine-readable format so you can share it with a third party if you choose to.Current customers:Please request your data through our web form(new tab).You will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. This link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. And please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request.Former customers:You can download personal data you provided up to 6 months after account closure date. To request this information, complete a data request form(new tab) and make sure that the information you provide correctly matches all your previous account information. You’ll need to know:the first and last name, personal ID number, and expiration date of the identification document (national ID card or passport) you used to verify the account,the registered email address of the account,the date (month and year) you created and closed your account (check your verification email).For security reasons, we have to make sure it’s really you downloading the data: if any field is inaccurate or missing, your request will not be successful.You will be asked to create a temporary password to use for the link we send to your registered email address. This link is only valid for 24 hours from the moment you received the email. And please note that if the password is entered incorrectly five times, the link will become invalid and you will need to create a new export request.If you want more information about the collection, use, and processing of your personal data, please visit our updated Privacy Policy (DEU(new tab)) (EU(new tab)).

title: How to close my account?
content: We are sorry to see you go, but we appreciate the time you spent with us as a customer. You have convenient options to close your N26 account.If you have a DE or ES IBANYou can use the following methods to request account closure:Option 1: Click here(new tab) to be guided through our electronic account closure process:This option is the fastest way to close your account.You will need to login to authenticate yourself.You will be guided through the process to close your account.If you cannot log in or do not want to, please follow the steps for Option 2.Option 2: Please contact us via live chat or via email to closure@n26.com(new tab) from your registered email address using our cancellation form(new tab) (the form will require the below information):A statement requesting the closure of your account on a specific date or ASAP.Your name.Your N26 IBAN.If you have a positive balance in your main account or your Spaces, we also need an IBAN within SEPA to transfer your remaining balance.If you have an IT IBANYou can use the following method to request account closure:Please send your request through live chat (click the Start New Support Chat button below) or via email to closure@n26.com(new tab) from your registered email address using our cancellation form(new tab) (the form will require the below information):A statement requesting the closure of your account on a specific date or ASAP.Your name.Your N26 IBAN.If you have a positive balance in your main account or your Spaces, we also need an IBAN within SEPA to transfer your remaining balance.A few things to consider when closing your account:For a quick account closure: if you have a positive balance, please transfer your remaining balance yourself. If you have a negative balance, top up your account.Destroy your cards by cutting them with scissors or a paper shredder. The chip, NFC antenna and the magnetic strip should all be cut into pieces and disposed of separately. (For cards that cannot be easily destroyed by cutting, please store your card in a safe place.)

title: How to file a complaint?
content:
Looking for support or have a question
If you don't wish to make a complaint but you have questions about our products or need help with your account, we’re always happy to assist. You can email us at support@n26.com (new tab)(new tab), or just open a chat with us directly within the mobile app or WebApp, that's the fastest and simplest way to get in touch.Raising a complaint
We’re sorry you feel the need to raise a complaint, please see below for the ways you are able to do this.If you are dissatisfied with one of our products or services, you can send us an email from your registered email address* or send your complaint via post to the address to:N26 Bank GmbH – Complaint Management
Klosterstraße 62, 10179 Berlin, GermanyTo submit your complaint via email please write to the following email address litiges@n26.com(new tab) (new tab).Alternatively you can request to raise a complaint via our live support team and they will be happy to assist.When filing a complaint, please always include:Your full name email and home addressThe product or service you're unhappy happy withA description of your complaint and when this occurred. You can also include any supporting documentation you have in relation to your complaint We’ll contact you via email to confirm that we’ve received your complaint and then begin our investigation. In case we need more information from you, our Complaint Management department will reach out directly via email with an explanation of the information required.
Once our Complaint Management department has investigated your concerns we will provide you with a final decision via email. If you are unhappy with the outcome of your complaintIf you are not satisfied with the resolution provided, you can escalate your complaint to an independent third party.For example:An arbitration body is available to you at the German Federal Bank (Deutsche Bundesbank)Or you could file a complaint with the German Federal Financial Supervisory Authority (Bundesanstalt für Finanzdienstleistungsaufsicht – BaFin) The European Commission has also set up the Online Dispute Resolution platform to help consumers dispute out of court.We are committed to constantly improving our products and services and your feedback makes this possible. Should you wish to provide us with feedback regarding anything, please write to us at ideas@n26.com(new tab) (new tab).* We can only discuss account related matters from an email address registered with the N26 account

title: Who can get a Basiskonto?
content: You can open a free N26 bank account through our website or by downloading our app. The German Payment Accounts Act (Zahlungskontengesetz or ZKG) also gives all consumers who legally reside in the European Union the right to hold a basic payment account. This applies to those who live in a supported country.The N26 Basiskonto comes with a monthly 6€ account management fee. You can find all other fees in our pricing lists. If you don’t have a bank account at N26 or at any other financial institution in Germany yet, you can apply. Under some circumstances, N26 is allowed to reject your request.  Please note that some products and services such as N26 Overdraft, N26 Credit, N26 You, or N26 Metal are not accessible with an N26 Basiskonto.

title: How to get a Basiskonto?
content:
Download the request form(new tab) and complete it with a handwritten signature.In the request form you’ll find an attached coupon for legitimation at Deutsche Post AG. Go to your nearest Deutsch Post office, in order to prove your identity with the coupon.In addition, send us the completed and signed request via post to:
N26 Bank GmbH
Stw.: ZKG Basiskonto
Klosterstraße 62
10179 Berlin, DeutschlandOnce we’ve received your form and determined whether we can open a Basiskonto for you, we’ll send you an email including the contract and the T&Cs(new tab).You then send us your signed contract via post to our address.As soon as we receive the contract we’ll open a Basiskonto for you. You’ll receive a notification about the delivery of your card and access to your account.

title: Why can’t I get a Basiskonto?
content: Under some circumstances, N26 is allowed to reject your Basiskonto request. That’s the case if you:Live outside of a supported country.Already have an N26 bank account or another bank account in Germany and can use it to its full extent. Were convicted of a crime against the bank, its employees, or its customers within the past 3 years. Have already maintained a Basiskonto at N26 in the past that was closed due to prohibited usage or a negative balance. You didn’t meet minimum requirements in accordance to the Money Laundering Act and the Credit Services Act.

title: How much does an N26 account cost?
content: An N26 bank account is free.*Additional charges may apply, depending on your region:Pricing in Germany(new tab)Pricing in Austria(new tab)Pricing in France(new tab)Pricing in Spain(new tab)Pricing in Italy(new tab)Pricing in the rest of Europe(new tab)*If we’re not able to offer you an N26 account based on our minimum requirements(new tab), you may be able to open an N26 Flex account.

title: What are the benefits of N26 Metal?
content:
ℹ️ Available in Germany, Austria, France, Spain, Italy, Belgium, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Slovakia, Poland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein.Upgrade to N26 Metal and you’ll receive 10 additional Spaces, dedicated Customer Support, access to exclusive partner offerings(new tab), as well as the N26 Metal insurance package, provided by Allianz Global Assistance*, which covers a broad range of personal and financial benefits such as:Travel insurance. Reimbursement of medical expenses abroad, for travel cancellations after a medical emergency, expenses incurred during a flight delay of more than 4 hours, expenses in the event of a checked-in luggage delay of more than 6 hours, and medical repatriation expenses.
Snow and mountain rescue. Get covered for search, rescue, first transportation costs, and medical expenses in the event of accidents during a trip in the mountains.
Mobile phone theft insurance. Compensation if your smartphone is stolen in your home country or abroad.
Travel car rental. Get vehicle coverage in the event of damage or theft.Extra card. You can purchase an extra N26 Metal card for a one-off fee of 10€ through your N26 app. Keep these in mind when considering N26 Metal(new tab):N26 Metal features an NFC-enabled Mastercard with a metal core in your choice of charcoal black, quartz rose, or slate grey.If you’re a new customer, the first fee will be deducted 15 days after you prove your identity. From then on, you’ll be charged your monthly fee on your sign-up date.Please top up your account right after completing the sign up with at least the amount of the monthly Metal fee in order to receive the card If you upgrade to N26 Metal, the monthly fee of €16,90 will be deducted directly from your N26 account every month starting on the date of your upgrade.If you were previously an N26 You member, all purchases and travel booked using your N26 You Mastercard will remain insured.The minimum membership is one year. Your contract automatically renews if you do not cancel your membership at least 4 weeks before the contract expires.You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 14€ through your N26 app. *Allianz Global Assistance Europe trade name of AWP P&C S.A. - Dutch branch, and member of the Allianz Group.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to upgrade to Metal?
content: ℹ️ Available in Germany, Austria, France, Spain, Italy, Belgium, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Poland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Iceland, Liechtenstein.N26 Metal is available during initial sign-up, or by upgrading in the mobile app if you already have a N26 bank account or a N26 You membership. To upgrade to N26 Metal from the mobile app, simply go to the Explore tab and select Get N26 Metal. and choose between a Charcoal Black, Quartz Rose, or Slate Grey card.Check the conditions of the delivery and accept the N26 Metal T&Cs(new tab). Once you confirm your request by entering your Confirmation PIN, your new card will be on the way.Standard deliveries take up to 10 business days.The membership fee of €16,90 will be deducted directly from your account every month on the date of your upgrade.The minimum contract period for the N26 Metal membership is one year. Your membership will automatically renew unless you cancel it up to four weeks before the contract ends.All purchases and travel booked using your N26 You Mastercard will remain insured.If you’re already a N26 You member, you don’t have to pay the fees for the N26 You membership on top.You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 14€ through your N26 app. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: What are the benefits of N26 You?
content:
Once you upgrade to N26 You, you’ll receive 10 additional Spaces and the option to choose one of our five new card colours: Rhubarb, Ocean, Sand, Aqua, and Slate. N26 You customers are also covered under the premium account's insurance package provided by Allianz Global Assistance*, which includes a broad range of personal and financial benefits such as:Travel insurance: Reimbursement of medical expenses abroad, for travel cancellations after a medical emergency, expenses incurred during a flight delay of more than 4 hours, expenses in the event of a checked-in luggage delay of more than 6 hours, and medical repatriation expenses.
Snow and mountain rescue. Get covered for search, rescue, first transportation costs, and medical expenses in the event of accidents during a trip in the mountains.Car, bike and scooter sharing. Coverage for any damage or theft of vehicles rented from ride-sharing companies.Extra card. You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 10€ through your N26 app (available in Germany, Spain, Austria, Italy). If you’re an N26 You customer, or if you want to upgrade to N26 You, you’ll have the possibility to choose one of our five new colors when ordering a new card: Keep these in mind when considering N26 You(new tab):The N26 You Mastercard has no embossing: the card details, including the number, CVV code, and 10-digit token are printed on the back.If you upgrade to N26 You, the monthly fee of €9,90 will be deducted directly from your N26 account every month starting on the date of your upgrade. If you’re a new customer, the first fee will be deducted 15 days after you prove your identity. From then on, you’ll be charged your monthly fee on your sign-up date. Meaning that, if you opened your account at the end of the month, the first two  monthly fees will be charged the following month.The minimum membership is one year. Your contract automatically renews if you don’t cancel your membership at least 4 weeks before the contract expires.*Allianz Global Assistance Europe trade name of AWP P&C S.A. - Dutch branch, and member of the Allianz Group.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to upgrade to N26 You?
content: ℹ️ Applies to Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Poland, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden.You can upgrade to N26 You during initial sign-up, or by upgrading in the mobile app if you have a standard N26 bank account. To upgrade to N26 You in the mobile app, simply go to the Explore tab and select Get N26 You. You can choose between one of our five new colours when ordering a new card: Rhubarb, Ocean, Sand, Aqua, and Slate.Then choose your preferred delivery method, accept the N26 You T&C's(new tab) and your new card will be on the way. Standard deliveries take up to 10 business days whereas express deliveries take 3 business days. The membership fee of €9,90 will be deducted directly from your account every month on the date of your upgrade.The minimum contract period for the N26 You membership is one year. Your membership will automatically renew unless you cancel it up to four weeks before the contract ends. You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 14€ through your N26 app.

title: How to cancel my N26 You or N26 Metal membership?
content: N26 You(new tab) or N26 Metal(new tab) contracts have a term of one year. This contract automatically renews for another year unless you cancel it. In this article you will find the difference between revocation, cancellation of the membership and cancellation of the renewal of your membership. You have 3 options:Revoke your membership within the 14-day revocation periodCancel your membership at any time up to 1 month before your contract endsStop your membership’s renewal up to 1 month before it expiresFind in details how to do so below. RevocationYou can revoke your membership within the 14-day revocation period. Simply open a chat with us and we'll assist you from there.Keep in mind that if you cancel your contract before it ends, you won’t be able to sign up for the same membership plan in the future.Cancel your membership at any time*If you want to terminate your membership at any time up to *1 month before your contract ends and after the 14-day revocation period, please contact us.If you choose this option all your N26 You or N26 Metal benefits will end, which includes your insurance coverage.Stop the renewal of your membership You have up to 4 weeks before your membership expires to cancel the renewal of your N26 You or N26 Metal membership. To do so:Log into the mobile app and go to 👤 My AccountSelect N26 You/MetalTap Membership details followed by Cancel Membership you can also see your membership expiration date hereConfirm the cancellation via the push message we send youYou can continue to use your N26 You or N26 Metal Mastercard fully until your membership expires. That means you’ll keep your insurance coverage as long as you’re still required to pay your membership fee. After that, your Mastercard will work like a standard card without the benefits. We’ll send you a standard card before your contract ends. No need to contact us about it.We’ll notify you of the renewal via email 8 weeks before your anniversary date.If you want to definitely close your account, visit our article How to close my N26 account.

title: How to report an insurance claim?
content: Your N26 You(new tab) and N26 Metal(new tab) membership includes a wide range of insurance benefits, covered by our partner Allianz Global Assistance Europe.*To report a claim, log into your app, go to 👤 My Account and select N26 You/Metal, then select Make a claim.There you'll find:A guide to submit your claim (for example, flight or luggage delay, extended warranty, or travel cancellation)Your account and contract information, including your N26 You or N26 Metal IDThe option to contact Allianz directly in the case of a medical emergencyFor emergencies, please have the following information ready:The full address and telephone number of your current locationNames of all official contacts (doctors, hospitals, and/or police)An exact description of the situation*Allianz Global Assistance Europe is a trading name of AWP P&C S.A. - Dutch branch, and a member of the Allianz Group.

title: How does N26 Business work?
content: ℹ️ Applies to Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.It’s not yet possible to switch between accounts so it’s important to know if N26 Business is right for you:The N26 Business account is designed for self-employed and freelance users doing business under their own name. That means you can’t have your company’s name on the account or card.The N26 Business Mastercard is intended for business use only. You receive 0.1% cashback every month on all payments made using the card. It’s currently not possible to have two separate N26 accounts at the same time so if you also need a card for private expenses, we recommend ordering a Maestro card (it’s available in Germany, Austria, and the Netherlands).As with the N26 bank account, the account is free and we cover certain cash withdrawals as part of our Fair Use Policy. Unlike other accounts, transfers in foreign currencies aren’t possible with N26 Business within the app. You can visit Transferwise(new tab) for this.Business to business (B2B) payments are not supported with a N26 Business account. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How does N26 Business You work?
content: ℹ️ Applies to Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, and Sweden.It’s not yet possible to switch between private and business accounts so it’s important to know if N26 Business You is right for you:The N26 Business You account is designed for self-employed and freelance users doing business under their own name. That means you can’t have your company’s name on the account or card. The account is €9,90 per month. The minimum membership is one year. Your contract automatically renews if you do not cancel your membership(new tab) at least 4 weeks before the contract expires.  The premium account includes: Allianz Insurance Package including coverage for business purposes and fee-free foreign currency ATM withdrawals, The N26 Business Mastercard is intended for business use only. You receive 0.1% cashback every month on all payments made using the card. It’s currently not possible to have two separate N26 accounts at the same time so if you also need a card for private expenses, we recommend ordering a Maestro card (it’s available in Germany and Austria, and the Netherlands).Transfers in foreign currencies aren’t possible with N26 Business You.You can sign-up during registration or if you’re already an N26 Business user.You can purchase an extra N26 Business You card for a one-off fee of 10€ through your N26 app. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How does N26 Business Metal work?
content: ℹ️ Applies to Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, and Sweden.It’s not yet possible to switch between private and business accounts so it’s important to know if N26 Business Metal is right for you:The N26 Business Metal account is designed for self-employed and freelance users doing business under their own name. That means you can’t have your company’s name on the account or card. The account is €16,90 per month. The minimum membership is one year. Your contract automatically renews if you do not cancel your membership(new tab) at least 4 weeks before the contract expires.  The premium account includes: Allianz Insurance Package including coverage for business purposes and fee-free foreign currency ATM withdrawals, The N26 Business Mastercard is intended for business use only. You receive 0.5% cashback every month on all payments made using the card. It’s currently not possible to have two separate N26 accounts at the same time so if you also need a card for private expenses, we recommend ordering a Maestro card (it’s available in Germany and Austria, and the Netherlands).Transfers in foreign currencies aren’t possible with N26 Business Metal.You can sign-up during registration or if you’re already an N26 Business user.You can purchase an extra N26 Business Metal card for a one-off fee of 10€ through your N26 app. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: When will my card arrive?
content: Standard delivery takes up to 15 business days and is free of charge if it's your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership. To stay up-to-date on the delivery progress simply go to the home screen of your N26 mobile app.Express delivery takes up to 3 working days and comes with an additional fee of 20€. In addition to the banner on the home screen of your N26 mobile app, you will also receive an email with a tracking link to stay up-to-date on the progress of your card delivery. Learn more in our dedicated article about express delivery.Please wait until the estimated delivery time has elapsed before taking further action. Your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership is always free. For the following ones, a replacement fee may apply.How to make sure your card is on it's way

title: How to order my card with express delivery?
content: Express delivery is a good option if you need your card in a hurry or if postal deliveries have sometimes failed to reach you for whatever reason.You’ll be given the option to select express delivery when choosing a delivery method for your first card or if you reorder a card. You’ll then receive a tracking link by email. If you’re not home during the delivery and your mailbox can’t be accessed, the card will be left at a nearby access point (you can find it through the provided tracking link). The card only stays at the access point for a limited amount of time. After that, it’ll be returned to us. We’ll inform you by email if that happens.If you order via express delivery, keep in mind that:Your new Standard, N26 You or Metal Mastercard will be delivered within 2-3 working days. Deliveries take place between 08:00 and 12:00. Deliveries can be made by DHL express to all of our supported countries within Europe. It’s currently not possible to make deliveries to other countries.It’s not possible to cancel or change an express delivery once it’s been selected as the delivery method.To close an account, you must pay for the express delivery of your card.If your card hasn’t arrived within 3-5 working days of placing your order, please check the tracking link for an update. You can also use the tracking link to inform DHL directly about the details of your delivery address or to redirect the shipment if you can’t be there at the time of delivery.N26 Standard and N26 You cards have a fee of €10 for standard shipping and €30 for express shipping (which includes the €10 card replacement fee).

title: How to activate my card?
content:
Once you receive your physical card, you’ll need to activate it. You can do this in the app only after you connect your smartphone to your account. Or you can activate it directly from the web app(new tab). You’ll need your 10-digit token number: it’s found below your name on the front of your card (or on the back if you have an N26 You, N26 Metal, or Maestro card). To activate your card on the N26 app, from the Home screen:Go to the Actions tab,Select Cards settings and swipe until you see the card you want to activate,Tap Activate.
To activate your card on the web app, just select Activate card from the Home screen.If you live in France, Spain, Ireland, Greece, Finland, or Estonia you must make a first ATM withdrawal to fully activate your card.If you have multiple cards (for example, you ordered your card more than once or your delivery was delayed), you can only activate your most recent card. All other cards will be disabled.You’ll need to follow these activation steps every time you reorder a new card, like if your card is lost, stolen, broken, or you upgrade your account.   After you activate your card, the next step is choosing a card PIN.

title: How to block my N26 card?
content: You can block and unblock your cards at any time in the app. Go to the Actions tab and select Card settings. There you can decide if you want to temporarily limit or disable your ATM withdrawals, online payments or payments abroad, or block your card entirely.This way, you have full control of your card and can protect yourself against unauthorized transactions. You should immediately block your card if anything looks suspicious. You can always unblock it later.If you do not have access to your N26 mobile app or your N26 webapp login, you can also request to block your card or account by calling us at +44 2035 107126 or +49 303 6428 6881 (both lines in English) .

title: How to change my card limits?
content: You can change your card PIN, define your daily withdrawal or payment limits enable or disable your ATM withdrawals and online or payments abroad. To do this:Select 'Actions' in the mobile app or WebApp(new tab)Then go to 'Card Settings'Each change you make is applied instantly to all of your cards.You can also block your card or order a new one in case it’s lost or stolen.Prefer a video over text

title: How to set my card PIN?
content: We don’t send you a PIN via post; you set the PIN for your Mastercard or Maestro card once you’ve successfully connected your smartphone to your account and activated your card(s). To set or change your card PIN:Go to the Actions tab.Select Card settings and swipe to choose a card.Select Reset PIN on the mobile or WebApp(new tab).Enter the 10-digit token number on your card.Choose your new PIN and confirm it.Keep in mind that:If you live in France, Spain, Ireland, Greece, Finland, or Estonia, you must make your first payment using Chip and PIN before you can use your card anywhere else. You can also first make a withdrawal or balance inquiry at ATM instead.For security reasons we don’t accept any PIN containing elements of your birth date, address, or any combination of repeated digits or numerical sequences (such as 1111, 1234, or 4321). If the number you’ve chosen is not accepted please try again using a different combination.If a PIN is entered incorrectly three times in a row, the card will automatically be blocked for security reasons. If this happens, please contact our Customer Support via chat so we can unblock it for you.Your card PIN is separate from your Confirmation PIN, however you can choose the same PIN for both.

title: How to use my card digitally?
content: You can make purchases with your smartphone:Simply add your N26 card to your Apple Pay or Google Pay wallet in order to make purchases at merchants who support this payment method.You can enable this feature before your card arrives in the mail to start using your N26 account straight away but also once you have received your card and activated it.To add your card to your wallet follow these steps:Login to your N26 accountGo to 'Actions'Select 'Card Settings' and swipe to select the card you want to addSelect 'Add to Apple Pay' or 'Add to Google Pay'Good to know:Whilst waiting for your card to arrive this feature is available for 30 days after your physical card is being produced. If you don't activate your card within the timeframe then this feature will be suspended. Once you activate your card you will be able to continue using it digitally again.This feature is not enabled if you reorder your card or upgrade to a premium membership without blocking your current card. In these cases your current card will continue working with 'Apple Pay' or 'Google Pay' until you activate your new card.How to view my complete card details in the N26 app

title: Why didn't an ATM give me cash?
content: Why didn’t an ATM give me Cash

title: How often can I withdraw cash for free?
content: Cash withdrawals using your Mastercard depend on your T&C country (the address you originally shipped your first card to):Germany:N26 Standard and N26 Business: 3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. You can also use CASH26. For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.N26 You and N26 Business You: 5 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. You can also use CASH26. Free ATM withdrawals in currencies other than the euro.N26 Metal: 8 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. You can also use CASH26. Outside of Germany, in the eurozone you receive unlimited free ATM withdrawals in euros.Austria and Italy:Free and unlimited ATM withdrawals (including CASH26).For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.France, Spain, the Netherlands, and the Rest of Europe:N26 Standard and N26 Business: 3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.N26 You and N26 Business You: 5 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. Free ATM withdrawals in currencies other than the euro.N26 Metal and N26 Business Metal: 8 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. Free ATM withdrawals in currencies other than the euro.Switzerland:N26 Standard and N26 Business: 3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.There’s always a €2 fee if you use your Maestro card to withdraw cash (only available in Germany, Austria, and the Netherlands).Check our pricing lists if you’ve been charged an ATM fee.*For all countries (except Austria and Italy): You receive 5 free withdrawals during the first three months and after that you will receive 3 free withdrawals. To continue to make use of our 5 free ATM withdrawals a month and stay as a primary account user, you will need to receive regular income paid into your N26 account of at least 1000€ for two consecutive months. These payments can be 1 or more of the following: Salary, pension, student allowance or government benefits.Any other type of regular payment.Multiple incoming transactions that add up to 1000€.Please note that we reserve the right to not grant or revoke the primary account user status if the 1000€ minimum transfer amount is achieved through misuse or you stop receiving these monthly payments.

title: Where can I withdraw cash for free?
content:
Your N26 Mastercard allows you to withdraw cash for free in ATMs from any bank, according to our Fair Use Policy.

However, we’ve been informed that some ATMs from other banks in Spain might charge a fee of around €2 to those customers who opened their account in a different country. At this time we’re unable to prevent this fee from being charged, but we can help get this money back for you if you contact us via in-app chat.

In the meantime, and in order to avoid complications, here’s a list of all the banks whose ATMs won’t charge you such a fee: Evo Banco, Deutsche Bank, Ing, Bankinter, Unicaja, Ibercaja, Liberbank, Triodos Bank, Kutxabank and Cajasur.

Find here more reasons why you could’ve been charged an ATM fee.

title: Why was I charged an ATM fee?
content: ATM fees could happen for a few reasons: A €2 fee applies to any additional withdrawal beyond our Fair Use Policy. You can identify this fee in your transaction history as a separate transaction. We’ll remind you via push message when you’re running low on free withdrawals. Some ATMs may come with their own fees. This fee will appear within the same transaction in your transaction list, that is added on top of the withdrawal amount. We have no control over these fees and can’t reject or reverse them. You’ll be informed before the end of a withdrawal if additional fees apply and will have the possibility of cancelling it.Foreign currency ATM withdrawals sometimes include fees. With the N26 account, there’s a fee of 1.7% of the withdrawal amount. This fee is waived for N26 You or N26 Metal members. Using your Maestro for ATM withdrawals. A €2 fee applies to both domestic or international withdrawals. Maestro is only available in Germany, Austria, or the Netherlands. Good to know:To avoid certain fees, especially when travelling, you can use the(new tab) Mastercard ATM Locator(new tab) to find free ATMs nearby by selecting no access fee.All ATMs that you can see in the ATM finder support Mastercard.You can find an overview of our plans and fees on our website(new tab).

title: How to make a SEPA transfer?
content:
ℹ️ You can send debit transfers to any country within the SEPA zone (if the receiving bank accepts Euros).Outgoing debit transfers can be made in either the N26 app or our Web app.From the Home screen choose the Actions tab,
Select Send Money followed by Bank Transfer and then “add a new recipient”,
Enter the recipient's name and IBAN and select Continue,
Choose the amount and select Next,
Add a message if required or select Skip It,
Check the Transfer Review screen (which sums up the transfer),
Here you can also schedule the date of your transfer and save it as a standing order,
Press send and confirm with your confirmation PIN.You’ll then need to either Confirm or Cancel the transfer via push notification in the app from your paired device.Once the transfer was confirmed in the mobile app, we can't reverse it or change the recipient's details.If you cannot confirm your debit transfer within the app you need to:Ensure that you have a stable internet connection.Ensure that your mobile phone has push notifications enabled. This is done through the phone settings, not in our app.Ensure that you use your paired device.Once your debit transfer is sent you’ll be able to download a PDF confirmation of it. To do so:Go to your Transactions list.
Locate and select the specific debit transfer.
Scroll down to the Transaction Information and tap PDF by selecting Transfer Confirmation.

title: Why did my SEPA transfer fail?
content: We accept transfers in EUR done via SEPA. We don't support SWIFT so if you need to make a foreign currency transfer, please use TransferWise (in the app or from their website(new tab)).To get a transfer, you'll only need to provide the sender with your full name (as it's written on the ID you provided for verification) and your IBAN.You can find your IBAN on your balance statements and in 👤 My Account (in the mobile app or WebApp(new tab)).Common reasons for failed transfers:The recipient's name on the transfer order is different from the name on their account (must be their name as written on their ID).The recipient's name is a company name instead of a personal/account name (applies to N26 Business).The IBAN is incorrect.You're not receiving the push message to confirm your transfer.An inappropriate use was found. N26 has the responsibility to run routine checks on transactions (see GwG § 10(new tab)). As a result, we may ask for documentation to verify the origin or source of these transactions. This can result in the credit being delayed or not taking place.

title: How to save the details of a transfer recipient?
content: Every time you make a transfer to a new recipient in the app (tap + then Transfer and Add new recipient), some details like the recipient’s name and IBAN are automatically saved in your transfer contact list for future transfers. You can also delete contacts or view your transaction history with them:iOS: swipe a contact entry to the left in order to show the transaction history or delete the entry.Android: tap and hold on a contact entry in order to show the transaction history or delete the entry.Keep in mind that deleting a contact entry doesn’t delete your transaction history with them.

title: Why is my transfer still pending in the N26 app?
content: You’ll need your Confirmation PIN to finalize all transfers whether MoneyBeam, standing orders, or CASH26. Your transfer will remain pending until you either Confirm or Cancel it via push message in the app.Your Confirmation PIN differs from your card PIN but you can use the same number for both. You’ll be asked to choose your Confirmation PIN after connecting your smartphone (whereas you select a card PIN after activating your card).If you enter your Confirmation PIN incorrectly 6 times in a row, your PIN will be blocked for security reasons. You can restore your PIN by changing it in the app: go to 👤 My Account then tap Settings and Security. Then tap Change Confirmation PIN (iPhone) or Reset Confirmation PIN (Android).

title: How do I return a SEPA transfer to its sender?
content: From the 17th March, customers from other banks can request—at their bank institution—the return of a SEPA transfer from an N26 customer.The sender of a SEPA transfer can now request the recall of their funds from the receiving N26 account by reaching out to the sender bank. This request appears to N26 customers in the form of a push notification on their paired device. Similarly to confirming a debit transfer in the N26 app, you’ll then have the option to reject or accept the credit transfer recall.If you do not confirm or reject the transfer recall request after 15 days, the request is rejected automatically. Once the transfer recall is accepted, the funds will leave your account and you cannot request them back. If you don’t have sufficient funds in your Main Account, you’ll not be able to confirm the transfer recall.

title: How to make transfers in foreign currencies?
content: We have partnered with TransferWise to make foreign currency transfers easy. TransferWise offers real-time exchange rates and no hidden fees.To initiate a transfer in a foreign currency start by logging into the mobile app: From the Home screen choose the Actions tabSelect Send Money followed by Foreign Currency TransferSelect the desired currency and enter the amount you would like to send in € (it will automatically convert into the foreign currency below). After that, you add a new recipient or select an existing payeeFinalise the transfer with your Confirmation PINIf we don’t currently offer the foreign currency(new tab) you need, please visit TransferWise(new tab) for more currency options. You can log in by entering your N26 account email and selecting Forgot password

title: How long does it take to send money with TransferWise?
content: Once you've initiated your transfer via TransferWise you'll be given an estimated time frame. When making a transfer, ensure that the recipients name exactly matches the name on their bank account! If a TransferWise transfer fails, we’ll notify you via push message. The amount will automatically be returned to your account a few days later.You can't personally cancel a transfer, but if you get in touch with TransferWise support this way they can cancel the transfer for you. Keep in mind that the transfer can only be cancelled up until the point TransferWise pays out your funds. Once the money has been sent to the recipient, it's not possible to cancel the transfer anymore.The recipients details can only be changed up until the point that TransferWise has paid out your money. After your money has been paid out, the recipients details can no longer be changed. You can get in touch with TransferWise this way.TransferWise doesn’t charge extra fees for a returned payment and neither do we. However, some participating banks do charge fees, in which case TransferWise will deduct this amount from the money returned under their Conditions of Use(new tab).Common reasons for a failed transfer:Error in the transfer details (for example, when entering the recipient’s name or account information).Special characters or too many characters in the recipient’s name or reference field.Limits have been reached or online payments aren’t active in card settings.Foreign currency transfers aren’t possible with N26 Business or N26 Business You or if the recipient is a business account.

title: How long do transfers take?
content: All domestic and international incoming SEPA transfers are instant if they come from a bank that supports instant transfers and the sender selects this option. Banking regulation applies to SEPA instant transfers and may delay the transfer in case it needs additional monitoring e.g. when sending large amounts of money.In case the sending bank doesn’t offer instant transfers or the sender doesn’t choose this option, all SEPA transfers should arrive within a maximum of 2 working days. Please note that outgoing SEPA transfers are completed within one banking day.If the transfer is not instant, keep in mind that if a transfer has been made right before a weekend or bank holiday, the time frame will be extended. We send our SEPA payment orders through TARGET2(new tab). It’s open to process payments every working day from 07:00 to 18:00 CET. The system is closed on the following days:1 January (New Year's Day)Good Friday, Easter Monday1 May (Labour Day)25 December (Christmas Day)26 December.With MoneyBeam, you can transfer money to other N26 customers instantly and you can also receive instant MoneyBeam requests from banks that support instant transfers. Times vary for foreign currency transfers with TransferWise (but you’ll see an estimated transfer time on the quote screen).You'll need to confirm each type of transfer via push message in the app before we send anything out.Please note: we only accept transfers in EUR via SEPA (that means no SWIFT transfers).If your incoming transfer is outside of these estimated time frames, please contact the sender (bank) for a payment investigation. We can't investigate incoming transfers.

title: Why did my TransferWise account linking fail?
content: We are sorry that you cannot currently link your existing TransferWise account. The most common reason why this could have happened is due to incomplete personal details on your TransferWise account. If you have set up an account in the past directly with TransferWise using the same email address as that registered on your N26 account, and you did not fill out all personal details, we will not be able to link your account within N26. Please log into your TransferWise account at www.transferwise.com/login(new tab), or via their app, and ensure that your full name, address, date of birth and phone number are complete. If you cannot remember your password, go to www.transferwise.com/login(new tab) and select ‘Forgot password’ to reset your password and access your account.If you cannot remember creating an account with TransferWise, you should still try to log in by resetting your password. It could be that it was created via another partner or some time ago.

title: How to create and manage standing orders?
content: When setting up an outgoing transfer in either the N26 app or Web app you’ll have the option to make it a standing order.Once you complete the outgoing transfer you'll then be prompted to tick a box which will create a standing order. After you've inputted the amount of the transfer and its recipient, under the reference text field select "Want to save this as a standing order

title: Why was I charged a direct debit fee?
content: Direct debits returned to your account due to insufficient funds* are charged a €3 fee in accordance with our Terms & Conditions(new tab). If your balance becomes negative due to this fee, overdraft interest will also apply at a rate of 8.9%.You can avoid these fees by making sure you have enough funds in your account to cover incoming direct debits by 18:00 on the same business day.We suggest you use SEPA Instant credit transfers, MoneyBeam (between N26 accounts) or CASH26 (if you live in Germany, Austria or Italy) to transfer the amount due. With these three methods, the amount will be credited to your account instantly.If you don’t recognize a direct debit, you can request a refund in the app.*For Non-Euro countries only: If you are setting up a direct debit with a merchant in your home currency, it's the receiving bank who dictates the currency exchange and the ultimate amount that is collected from us. You can check the list of countries below:BulgariaCroatiaCzech RepublicDenmarkHungaryIcelandLiechtensteinNorwayPolandRomaniaSwedenSwitzerland

title: How to request a refund for a direct debit?
content: You have the ability to request a SEPA direct debit refund in the app yourself up to 8 weeks after it has been debited.Open your transaction list and select the direct debit in question. Choose Refund. The amount will then be credited to your account within 2 banking days.*For Non-Euro countries only: If you are setting up a direct debit with a merchant in your home currency, it's the receiving bank who dictates the currency exchange and the ultimate amount that is collected from us. Please check the list of countries:BulgariaCroatiaCzech RepublicDenmarkHungaryIcelandLiechtensteinNorwayPolandRomaniaSwedenSwitzerland

title: What to do if my N26 IBAN is not accepted?
content: Your IBAN includes the 2 digit country code (e.g. DE), a two-digit check number, the eight-digit bank sort code, and your ten-digit account number. For example: DE XX 10011001 26XXXXXXXX.The participating countries of the SEPA area (Single Euro Payments Area) have agreed on the IBAN system in order to simplify national and international payments, and to reduce the risk of error in the communication and processing of transactions.Merchants or employers who do not accept IBANs from other member states of the European Economic Area are violating European law as of 1 February 2016 (Article 9 of Regulation No 260/2012(new tab)).If you are ever affected by IBAN discrimination, please contact your relevant national authority(new tab) directly and notify them. Provide your contact details, the name of the merchant or company that didn’t accept your IBAN, as well as a brief description of the incident (including a screenshot of the rejection or other documentation of your communication with them).

title: Where is my refund?
content:
In most cases, your refund will be visible in the app on the day of the original transaction, not the refund date. Scroll down your transaction list or download your previous balance statements to find it.To view and download PDFs of your (preliminary and previous) monthly balance statements:On the WebApp(new tab): From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads then select Bank statements.
On the mobile app: If you're using an iPhone, tap on the three dots to the right of your current balance from the main screen. A menu will pop up and will give you the option to access your balance statement. For Androids, you'll find the option under Statistics (just tap the 3 dots in the top right-hand corner).The amounts blocked as a car rental deposit can take up to 30 days to return to your account while a refund of a card payment will be automatically credited to your account within a maximum of 12 days.

title: Why was I charged more than expected?
content: All transactions take place in real-time. We'll alert you when any incoming or outgoing transaction happens via push message.Sometimes a transaction could look suspicious because the final debited amount can differ from the original transaction amount for a few reasons:A merchant blocks a higher amount for a deposit (for example, at a gas station, or a car rental or hotel booking), and the difference is credited to your account once the deposit is no longer required.Changes in exchange rates may result in slight differences in the total for transactions made in foreign currencies.In both cases, we don’t charge interest for the difference in amounts.But if you’re certain that a transaction is unauthorized by you, we could help get your money back.

title: How do contactless payments work?
content: It’s not possible to deactivate contactless payments. If you’re experiencing issues with your contactless payments, keep in mind that:  To activate contactless payments, you must first use your card at an ATM or payment terminal. Transactions up to €50 don’t require a card PIN*. For amounts over €50, you’ll need to enter your card PIN. *If the merchant's payment system supports this option.Make sure your card is held directly onto an NFC-compatible payment terminal.
