content: Standard delivery takes up to 15 business days and is free of charge if it's your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership. To stay up-to-date on the delivery progress simply go to the home screen of your N26 mobile app.Express delivery takes up to 3 working days and comes with an additional fee of 20€. In addition to the banner on the home screen of your N26 mobile app, you will also receive an email with a tracking link to stay up-to-date on the progress of your card delivery. Learn more in our dedicated article about express delivery.Please wait until the estimated delivery time has elapsed before taking further action. Your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership is always free. For the following ones, a replacement fee may apply.How to make sure your card is on it's way

title: How to activate my card?
content:
Once you receive your physical card, you’ll need to activate it. You can do this in the app only after you connect your smartphone to your account. Or you can activate it directly from the web app(new tab). You’ll need your 10-digit token number: it’s found below your name on the front of your card (or on the back if you have an N26 You, N26 Metal, or Maestro card). To activate your card on the N26 app, from the Home screen:Go to the Actions tab,Select Cards settings and swipe until you see the card you want to activate,Tap Activate.
To activate your card on the web app, just select Activate card from the Home screen.If you live in France, Spain, Ireland, Greece, Finland, or Estonia you must make a first ATM withdrawal to fully activate your card.If you have multiple cards (for example, you ordered your card more than once or your delivery was delayed), you can only activate your most recent card. All other cards will be disabled.You’ll need to follow these activation steps every time you reorder a new card, like if your card is lost, stolen, broken, or you upgrade your account.   After you activate your card, the next step is choosing a card PIN.

title: How to block my N26 card?
content: You can block and unblock your cards at any time in the app. Go to the Actions tab and select Card settings. There you can decide if you want to temporarily limit or disable your ATM withdrawals, online payments or payments abroad, or block your card entirely.This way, you have full control of your card and can protect yourself against unauthorized transactions. You should immediately block your card if anything looks suspicious. You can always unblock it later.If you do not have access to your N26 mobile app or your N26 webapp login, you can also request to block your card or account by calling us at +44 2035 107126 or +49 303 6428 6881 (both lines in English) .

title: How to change my card limits?
content: You can change your card PIN, define your daily withdrawal or payment limits enable or disable your ATM withdrawals and online or payments abroad. To do this:Select 'Actions' in the mobile app or WebApp(new tab)Then go to 'Card Settings'Each change you make is applied instantly to all of your cards.You can also block your card or order a new one in case it’s lost or stolen.Prefer a video over text

title: How to set my card PIN?
content: We don’t send you a PIN via post; you set the PIN for your Mastercard or Maestro card once you’ve successfully connected your smartphone to your account and activated your card(s). To set or change your card PIN:Go to the Actions tab.Select Card settings and swipe to choose a card.Select Reset PIN on the mobile or WebApp(new tab).Enter the 10-digit token number on your card.Choose your new PIN and confirm it.Keep in mind that:If you live in France, Spain, Ireland, Greece, Finland, or Estonia, you must make your first payment using Chip and PIN before you can use your card anywhere else. You can also first make a withdrawal or balance inquiry at ATM instead.For security reasons we don’t accept any PIN containing elements of your birth date, address, or any combination of repeated digits or numerical sequences (such as 1111, 1234, or 4321). If the number you’ve chosen is not accepted please try again using a different combination.If a PIN is entered incorrectly three times in a row, the card will automatically be blocked for security reasons. If this happens, please contact our Customer Support via chat so we can unblock it for you.Your card PIN is separate from your Confirmation PIN, however you can choose the same PIN for both.

title: How to use my card digitally?
content: You can make purchases with your smartphone:Simply add your N26 card to your Apple Pay or Google Pay wallet in order to make purchases at merchants who support this payment method.You can enable this feature before your card arrives in the mail to start using your N26 account straight away but also once you have received your card and activated it.To add your card to your wallet follow these steps:Login to your N26 accountGo to 'Actions'Select 'Card Settings' and swipe to select the card you want to addSelect 'Add to Apple Pay' or 'Add to Google Pay'Good to know:Whilst waiting for your card to arrive this feature is available for 30 days after your physical card is being produced. If you don't activate your card within the timeframe then this feature will be suspended. Once you activate your card you will be able to continue using it digitally again.This feature is not enabled if you reorder your card or upgrade to a premium membership without blocking your current card. In these cases your current card will continue working with 'Apple Pay' or 'Google Pay' until you activate your new card.How to view my complete card details in the N26 app

title: Why didn't an ATM give me cash?
content: Why didn’t an ATM give me Cash

title: How often can I withdraw cash for free?
content: Cash withdrawals using your Mastercard depend on your T&C country (the address you originally shipped your first card to):Germany:N26 Standard and N26 Business: 3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. You can also use CASH26. For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.N26 You and N26 Business You: 5 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. You can also use CASH26. Free ATM withdrawals in currencies other than the euro.N26 Metal: 8 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. You can also use CASH26. Outside of Germany, in the eurozone you receive unlimited free ATM withdrawals in euros.Austria and Italy:Free and unlimited ATM withdrawals (including CASH26).For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.France, Spain, the Netherlands, and the Rest of Europe:N26 Standard and N26 Business: 3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.N26 You and N26 Business You: 5 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. Free ATM withdrawals in currencies other than the euro.N26 Metal and N26 Business Metal: 8 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. Free ATM withdrawals in currencies other than the euro.Switzerland:N26 Standard and N26 Business: 3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of €2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.There’s always a €2 fee if you use your Maestro card to withdraw cash (only available in Germany, Austria, and the Netherlands).Check our pricing lists if you’ve been charged an ATM fee.*For all countries (except Austria and Italy): You receive 5 free withdrawals during the first three months and after that you will receive 3 free withdrawals. To continue to make use of our 5 free ATM withdrawals a month and stay as a primary account user, you will need to receive regular income paid into your N26 account of at least 1000€ for two consecutive months. These payments can be 1 or more of the following: Salary, pension, student allowance or government benefits.Any other type of regular payment.Multiple incoming transactions that add up to 1000€.Please note that we reserve the right to not grant or revoke the primary account user status if the 1000€ minimum transfer amount is achieved through misuse or you stop receiving these monthly payments.

title: Where can I withdraw cash for free?
content:
Your N26 Mastercard allows you to withdraw cash for free in ATMs from any bank, according to our Fair Use Policy.

However, we’ve been informed that some ATMs from other banks in Spain might charge a fee of around €2 to those customers who opened their account in a different country. At this time we’re unable to prevent this fee from being charged, but we can help get this money back for you if you contact us via in-app chat.

In the meantime, and in order to avoid complications, here’s a list of all the banks whose ATMs won’t charge you such a fee: Evo Banco, Deutsche Bank, Ing, Bankinter, Unicaja, Ibercaja, Liberbank, Triodos Bank, Kutxabank and Cajasur.

Find here more reasons why you could’ve been charged an ATM fee.

title: Why was I charged an ATM fee?
content: ATM fees could happen for a few reasons: A €2 fee applies to any additional withdrawal beyond our Fair Use Policy. You can identify this fee in your transaction history as a separate transaction. We’ll remind you via push message when you’re running low on free withdrawals. Some ATMs may come with their own fees. This fee will appear within the same transaction in your transaction list, that is added on top of the withdrawal amount. We have no control over these fees and can’t reject or reverse them. You’ll be informed before the end of a withdrawal if additional fees apply and will have the possibility of cancelling it.Foreign currency ATM withdrawals sometimes include fees. With the N26 account, there’s a fee of 1.7% of the withdrawal amount. This fee is waived for N26 You or N26 Metal members. Using your Maestro for ATM withdrawals. A €2 fee applies to both domestic or international withdrawals. Maestro is only available in Germany, Austria, or the Netherlands. Good to know:To avoid certain fees, especially when travelling, you can use the(new tab) Mastercard ATM Locator(new tab) to find free ATMs nearby by selecting no access fee.All ATMs that you can see in the ATM finder support Mastercard.You can find an overview of our plans and fees on our website(new tab).

title: How to make a SEPA transfer?
content:
ℹ️ You can send debit transfers to any country within the SEPA zone (if the receiving bank accepts Euros).Outgoing debit transfers can be made in either the N26 app or our Web app.From the Home screen choose the Actions tab,
Select Send Money followed by Bank Transfer and then “add a new recipient”,
Enter the recipient's name and IBAN and select Continue,
Choose the amount and select Next,
Add a message if required or select Skip It,
Check the Transfer Review screen (which sums up the transfer),
Here you can also schedule the date of your transfer and save it as a standing order,
Press send and confirm with your confirmation PIN.You’ll then need to either Confirm or Cancel the transfer via push notification in the app from your paired device.Once the transfer was confirmed in the mobile app, we can't reverse it or change the recipient's details.If you cannot confirm your debit transfer within the app you need to:Ensure that you have a stable internet connection.Ensure that your mobile phone has push notifications enabled. This is done through the phone settings, not in our app.Ensure that you use your paired device.Once your debit transfer is sent you’ll be able to download a PDF confirmation of it. To do so:Go to your Transactions list.
Locate and select the specific debit transfer.
Scroll down to the Transaction Information and tap PDF by selecting Transfer Confirmation.

title: Why did my SEPA transfer fail?
content: We accept transfers in EUR done via SEPA. We don't support SWIFT so if you need to make a foreign currency transfer, please use TransferWise (in the app or from their website(new tab)).To get a transfer, you'll only need to provide the sender with your full name (as it's written on the ID you provided for verification) and your IBAN.You can find your IBAN on your balance statements and in 👤 My Account (in the mobile app or WebApp(new tab)).Common reasons for failed transfers:The recipient's name on the transfer order is different from the name on their account (must be their name as written on their ID).The recipient's name is a company name instead of a personal/account name (applies to N26 Business).The IBAN is incorrect.You're not receiving the push message to confirm your transfer.An inappropriate use was found. N26 has the responsibility to run routine checks on transactions (see GwG § 10(new tab)). As a result, we may ask for documentation to verify the origin or source of these transactions. This can result in the credit being delayed or not taking place.

title: Why is my transfer still pending in the N26 app?
content: You’ll need your Confirmation PIN to finalize all transfers whether MoneyBeam, standing orders, or CASH26. Your transfer will remain pending until you either Confirm or Cancel it via push message in the app.Your Confirmation PIN differs from your card PIN but you can use the same number for both. You’ll be asked to choose your Confirmation PIN after connecting your smartphone (whereas you select a card PIN after activating your card).If you enter your Confirmation PIN incorrectly 6 times in a row, your PIN will be blocked for security reasons. You can restore your PIN by changing it in the app: go to 👤 My Account then tap Settings and Security. Then tap Change Confirmation PIN (iPhone) or Reset Confirmation PIN (Android).

title: How long do transfers take?
content: All domestic and international incoming SEPA transfers are instant if they come from a bank that supports instant transfers and the sender selects this option. Banking regulation applies to SEPA instant transfers and may delay the transfer in case it needs additional monitoring e.g. when sending large amounts of money.In case the sending bank doesn’t offer instant transfers or the sender doesn’t choose this option, all SEPA transfers should arrive within a maximum of 2 working days. Please note that outgoing SEPA transfers are completed within one banking day.If the transfer is not instant, keep in mind that if a transfer has been made right before a weekend or bank holiday, the time frame will be extended. We send our SEPA payment orders through TARGET2(new tab). It’s open to process payments every working day from 07:00 to 18:00 CET. The system is closed on the following days:1 January (New Year's Day)Good Friday, Easter Monday1 May (Labour Day)25 December (Christmas Day)26 December.With MoneyBeam, you can transfer money to other N26 customers instantly and you can also receive instant MoneyBeam requests from banks that support instant transfers. Times vary for foreign currency transfers with TransferWise (but you’ll see an estimated transfer time on the quote screen).You'll need to confirm each type of transfer via push message in the app before we send anything out.Please note: we only accept transfers in EUR via SEPA (that means no SWIFT transfers).If your incoming transfer is outside of these estimated time frames, please contact the sender (bank) for a payment investigation. We can't investigate incoming transfers.

title: How to save the details of a transfer recipient?
content: Every time you make a transfer to a new recipient in the app (tap + then Transfer and Add new recipient), some details like the recipient’s name and IBAN are automatically saved in your transfer contact list for future transfers. You can also delete contacts or view your transaction history with them:iOS: swipe a contact entry to the left in order to show the transaction history or delete the entry.Android: tap and hold on a contact entry in order to show the transaction history or delete the entry.Keep in mind that deleting a contact entry doesn’t delete your transaction history with them.

title: How to make transfers in foreign currencies?
content: We have partnered with TransferWise to make foreign currency transfers easy. TransferWise offers real-time exchange rates and no hidden fees.To initiate a transfer in a foreign currency start by logging into the mobile app: From the Home screen choose the Actions tabSelect Send Money followed by Foreign Currency TransferSelect the desired currency and enter the amount you would like to send in € (it will automatically convert into the foreign currency below). After that, you add a new recipient or select an existing payeeFinalise the transfer with your Confirmation PINIf we don’t currently offer the foreign currency(new tab) you need, please visit TransferWise(new tab) for more currency options. You can log in by entering your N26 account email and selecting Forgot password

title: How long does it take to send money with TransferWise?
content: Once you've initiated your transfer via TransferWise you'll be given an estimated time frame. When making a transfer, ensure that the recipients name exactly matches the name on their bank account! If a TransferWise transfer fails, we’ll notify you via push message. The amount will automatically be returned to your account a few days later.You can't personally cancel a transfer, but if you get in touch with TransferWise support this way they can cancel the transfer for you. Keep in mind that the transfer can only be cancelled up until the point TransferWise pays out your funds. Once the money has been sent to the recipient, it's not possible to cancel the transfer anymore.The recipients details can only be changed up until the point that TransferWise has paid out your money. After your money has been paid out, the recipients details can no longer be changed. You can get in touch with TransferWise this way.TransferWise doesn’t charge extra fees for a returned payment and neither do we. However, some participating banks do charge fees, in which case TransferWise will deduct this amount from the money returned under their Conditions of Use(new tab).Common reasons for a failed transfer:Error in the transfer details (for example, when entering the recipient’s name or account information).Special characters or too many characters in the recipient’s name or reference field.Limits have been reached or online payments aren’t active in card settings.Foreign currency transfers aren’t possible with N26 Business or N26 Business You or if the recipient is a business account.

title: Which foreign exchange rate will I get?
content:
When you use your N26 card to place transactions in foreign currencies, Mastercard’s exchange rates will be applied to the full purchase amount.Good news: N26 doesn’t charge any extra fees for foreign transactions!You can check Mastercard’s rates here: https://www.mastercard.us/en-us/personal/get-support/convert-currency.html(new tab)


You can check the exchange rate and currency markup rate applied to a past transaction on N26 app and website via transaction details on the feed.Please be aware that exchange rates are dynamic, so the transaction value can change until the final purchase amount is charged due to currency variation.

title: Why did my TransferWise account linking fail?
content: We are sorry that you cannot currently link your existing TransferWise account. The most common reason why this could have happened is due to incomplete personal details on your TransferWise account. If you have set up an account in the past directly with TransferWise using the same email address as that registered on your N26 account, and you did not fill out all personal details, we will not be able to link your account within N26. Please log into your TransferWise account at www.transferwise.com/login(new tab), or via their app, and ensure that your full name, address, date of birth and phone number are complete. If you cannot remember your password, go to www.transferwise.com/login(new tab) and select ‘Forgot password’ to reset your password and access your account.If you cannot remember creating an account with TransferWise, you should still try to log in by resetting your password. It could be that it was created via another partner or some time ago.

title: How to create and manage standing orders?
content: When setting up an outgoing transfer in either the N26 app or Web app you’ll have the option to make it a standing order.Once you complete the outgoing transfer you'll then be prompted to tick a box which will create a standing order. After you've inputted the amount of the transfer and its recipient, under the reference text field select "Want to save this as a standing order

title: Why was I charged a direct debit fee?
content: Direct debits returned to your account due to insufficient funds* are charged a €3 fee in accordance with our Terms & Conditions(new tab). If your balance becomes negative due to this fee, overdraft interest will also apply at a rate of 8.9%.You can avoid these fees by making sure you have enough funds in your account to cover incoming direct debits by 18:00 on the same business day.We suggest you use SEPA Instant credit transfers, MoneyBeam (between N26 accounts) or CASH26 (if you live in Germany, Austria or Italy) to transfer the amount due. With these three methods, the amount will be credited to your account instantly.If you don’t recognize a direct debit, you can request a refund in the app.*For Non-Euro countries only: If you are setting up a direct debit with a merchant in your home currency, it's the receiving bank who dictates the currency exchange and the ultimate amount that is collected from us. You can check the list of countries below:BulgariaCroatiaCzech RepublicDenmarkHungaryIcelandLiechtensteinNorwayPolandRomaniaSwedenSwitzerland

title: What to do if my N26 IBAN is not accepted?
content: Your IBAN includes the 2 digit country code (e.g. DE), a two-digit check number, the eight-digit bank sort code, and your ten-digit account number. For example: DE XX 10011001 26XXXXXXXX.The participating countries of the SEPA area (Single Euro Payments Area) have agreed on the IBAN system in order to simplify national and international payments, and to reduce the risk of error in the communication and processing of transactions.Merchants or employers who do not accept IBANs from other member states of the European Economic Area are violating European law as of 1 February 2016 (Article 9 of Regulation No 260/2012(new tab)).If you are ever affected by IBAN discrimination, please contact your relevant national authority(new tab) directly and notify them. Provide your contact details, the name of the merchant or company that didn’t accept your IBAN, as well as a brief description of the incident (including a screenshot of the rejection or other documentation of your communication with them).

title: How to request a refund for a direct debit?
content: You have the ability to request a SEPA direct debit refund in the app yourself up to 8 weeks after it has been debited.Open your transaction list and select the direct debit in question. Choose Refund. The amount will then be credited to your account within 2 banking days.*For Non-Euro countries only: If you are setting up a direct debit with a merchant in your home currency, it's the receiving bank who dictates the currency exchange and the ultimate amount that is collected from us. Please check the list of countries:BulgariaCroatiaCzech RepublicDenmarkHungaryIcelandLiechtensteinNorwayPolandRomaniaSwedenSwitzerland

title: Where is my refund?
content:
In most cases, your refund will be visible in the app on the day of the original transaction, not the refund date. Scroll down your transaction list or download your previous balance statements to find it.To view and download PDFs of your (preliminary and previous) monthly balance statements:On the WebApp(new tab): From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads then select Bank statements.
On the mobile app: If you're using an iPhone, tap on the three dots to the right of your current balance from the main screen. A menu will pop up and will give you the option to access your balance statement. For Androids, you'll find the option under Statistics (just tap the 3 dots in the top right-hand corner).The amounts blocked as a car rental deposit can take up to 30 days to return to your account while a refund of a card payment will be automatically credited to your account within a maximum of 12 days.

title: Why was I charged more than expected?
content: All transactions take place in real-time. We'll alert you when any incoming or outgoing transaction happens via push message.Sometimes a transaction could look suspicious because the final debited amount can differ from the original transaction amount for a few reasons:A merchant blocks a higher amount for a deposit (for example, at a gas station, or a car rental or hotel booking), and the difference is credited to your account once the deposit is no longer required.Changes in exchange rates may result in slight differences in the total for transactions made in foreign currencies.In both cases, we don’t charge interest for the difference in amounts.But if you’re certain that a transaction is unauthorized by you, we could help get your money back.

title: How does 3D Secure work?
content: 3D Secure protects you from online card fraud. It’s automatically activated when you activate your card in the app. No additional passwords are required.Whenever you make an online payment using your Mastercard, 3D Secure confirms the transaction with you within 5 minutes via a push message. If you don't see the transaction, try some of the troubleshooting tips we've collected.If you make a purchase using your smartphone, you’ll see a pending transaction in the app. Tap on the bell icon and the push message will appear for you to confirm and finalize your purchase. Then go back to the merchant’s website. You should see a confirmation of your successful purchase within a few moments.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: Why did my online purchase fail?
content: Some reasons why your online payment failed:If you are unable to confirm the push message within 5 minutes, simply restart the payment process on the merchant's website.If you do not receive a push message, please make sure that your smartphone is connected and that push messages are enabled on your smartphone.Ensure that online payments and payments abroad are enabled in your card settings.A stable internet connection is required.If you are using an iOS device, make sure you turn off the Do Not Disturb mode.If the amount on the merchant's site is different from the one stated in the push message, this may be due to the conversion of a foreign currency into euros.Make sure that you disable any Adblockers running on your browser.Your Maestro card can’t be used for online purchases.

title: How do contactless payments work?
content: It’s not possible to deactivate contactless payments. If you’re experiencing issues with your contactless payments, keep in mind that:  To activate contactless payments, you must first use your card at an ATM or payment terminal. Transactions up to €50 don’t require a card PIN*. For amounts over €50, you’ll need to enter your card PIN. *If the merchant's payment system supports this option.Make sure your card is held directly onto an NFC-compatible payment terminal. If you remove your card too fast or didn’t hold it close enough, just try again. N26 Metal cards only have NFC on the back side of the card. Make sure to hold the back side of the card against the terminal to use NFC (using the front won’t work).If contactless is not working, please always try to use the Chip and PIN method to complete your payment.

title: How to top up my account?
content: Once you are successfully verified, you'll be able to top up your account in several ways. To do so, simply go to the N26 app and select 'Add Money' to see the available options:1. SEPA Transfer (Up to 2 business days):The transfer must be in EUR and within the SEPA zone.You will need to provide your IBAN and your name as it is written on the ID you used to create your account.If you have a Business account, please keep in mind that we do not accept company names.2. Debit or Credit Card (instant):You can choose to deposit between 20€ and 150€.The first deposit is free. The following deposits charge a fee of 3% of the deposit amount.Simply enter the card details from the sending account.Please note, prepaid cards and American Express credit cards are not accepted.3. Apple Pay or Google Pay (instant):You can choose to deposit between 20€ and 150€.The first deposit is free. The following deposits charge a fee of 3% of the deposit amount.Simply enter the card details (credit or debit) linked to the Apple Pay or Google Pay account.Please note, prepaid cards and American Express credit cards are not accepted.4. Moneybeam (instant):You can receive money from other N26 users.5. CASH26 (instant):Available in Germany, Austria and Italy.Deposit cash through our partner stores once your card is activated and with your paired device.

title: How to keep track of my daily spending?
content:
We automatically sort your transactions and display our findings in Statistics (top-right corner of the mobile app) by sorting your:Categories: We collect information on retailers and payment reasons in order to improve our categorization (such as ATM, Food & Groceries, or Shopping). For example, if you send a MoneyBeam with the reference text Lunch, we’ll put it in the Bars & Restaurants category. If you feel like a category doesn’t fit, you can just change it by selecting the transaction and choosing a category from the drop-down list.
Hashtags: We’ve also added default hashtags for transaction times (#weekend), types of transactions (#books), or locations of purchases (#berlin). You can further sort your transactions by adding your own hashtags: tap on a transaction and then the pencil icon to add tags (such as #portugal_trip or #everymonth) or remove unwanted tags.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to export a list of my transactions?
content:
Our web app(new tab) allows you to search within your transactions. You can also download a history of your transactions in CSV format. To export your transaction list:From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads
Under CSV you can select the Start Date and End Date and Download CSVYou can also sort your transactions using categories and hashtags in the app.To view and download PDFs of your (preliminary and previous) monthly balance statements:In the web app(new tab): From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads then select Bank statements.
In the mobile app: From the Home screen, tap on the three bullet points in the top-right corner of the screen and choose Balance statements.

title: What if my balance is negative?
content: Your balance can be negative as long as you’re within your Overdraft limit. If you have a negative account balance, you'll be charged an overdraft interest rate of 8.9%.Otherwise, you’ll receive an email to notify you that the authorized limit of your account has been exceeded. This means you don’t have enough funds on your account to cover future charges.Even if you haven’t used your account since you opened it, certain charges still apply (such as N26 You or N26 Metal monthly fees or express delivery costs) and have resulted in a negative balance.So you’ll need to top up your account via SEPA transfer (choose international transfer if you’re making the transfer outside of Germany) or CASH26 (if you’re in Germany or Austria). Your account will remain active for the next 60 days without doing so. At that point:You’ll receive two additional reminders (each cost €3).If you have an Overdraft: it’ll be cancelled after the second reminder and you’ll have to repay that amount immediately (or you can set up a repayment plan).If you have an N26 You, N26 Metal, or N26 Business You account: all benefits will be cancelled after 60 days and your account will turn into a standard one.If you don’t respond after 60 days, we may close your account.

title: What is the maximum I can spend?
content: The maximum daily limits (total sum within 24 hours) for card payments are:ATM withdrawals: €2.500 (or €400 in Togo, Congo, Benin, Ivory Coast, Kenya, Cameroon, Nigeria, Senegal and Algeria)In-store or online payments: €5.000You can set your own daily ATM withdrawal and payment limits within our limits directly in the app by tapping 👤 My Account then Card settings.The maximum daily limits (rolling 24 hours) for bank transfers are:MoneyBeam to N26 customers (the recipient must be visible): €1.000Outgoing transfers: €50.000Incoming transfers: No limitThe maximum monthly limit (total sum) for card transactions refers at any given point in time to the past 30 days and is €20.000*. *a monthly limit of €10.000 applies to ATM withdrawals for customers who opened their account in France. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to use Moneybeam?
content:
MoneyBeam allows you to send money to your smartphone’s contacts without knowing their bank account details. In order to send a MoneyBeam, log into the app:From the Home screen choose the Actions tab,
Tap Send Money followed by the MoneyBeam option,
Either select a contact from your phone’s contact list or add a recipient manually, using their phone number or email address. For this to work, the recipient has to be visible as an N26 customer,
Enter the amount and a reference text,
Confirm with your Confirmation PIN and the push message you receive.N26 customers will receive the transfer instantly. You can send up to €1.000 to other N26 customers within a 24-hour period.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: Why can’t I see other N26 users on MoneyBeam?
content: To carry out real-time transactions such as MoneyBeams, N26 checks your smartphone’s contact list and finds other N26 users based on saved phone numbers or emails. You can also enter someone’s contact details manually to send them a MoneyBeam.If you don’t see your friend’s name on MoneyBeam but you know they’re an N26 user, they most likely haven’t made themselves visible. Indeed you can manage your visibility as an N26 user.Most MoneyBeam transfers that fail between N26 users happen because there are multiple phone numbers or emails listed in the contact entry of a phone's address book. To avoid this, make sure you have the email and phone number your friend uses in your phone book in order to send them MoneyBeams. If the contact details you have stored don’t match, you cannot send a MoneyBeam to your friend.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How does Spaces work?
content: Set goals, create and personalize Spaces, and transfer money between them instantly. Spaces is available in the mobile and WebApp(new tab).In addition to your main account (or primary space), you can create and delete additional Spaces as often as you’d like but the number of active Spaces at any one time depends on your account type: 2 additional Spaces with an N26 or N26 Business account or up to 10 additional Spaces with N26 You, N26 Business You and N26 Metal.Your primary account statements will include all transactions sent to a space or received from one. You can download balance statements from the confirmation page.Only your primary space can be negative (if you are eligible for an overdraft). All other balances in Spaces cannot be negative, meaning you can only transfer what is available in a particular space.You can only use the balance from your primary space toward your Mastercard transactions. So consider transferring money before making a purchase if needed.Move money from one space to another by holding down on your Main Account and dragging and dropping into your space. Once the amount is confirmed the balance is updated right away.You can lock and unlock a space at anytime from your mobile and web app. You'll only need to confirm with your confirmation PIN. If a space is locked, you’ll still be able to transfer money to it. If you need to withdraw money from a locked space, you need first to unlock it.You'll be able to hide the amount within the Space from your account's total balance. Just go into your Space, tap the three dots in the top right corner and select ‘Hide space balance’.Spaces includes a feature called Rules which will help you manage your time and your finances effectively.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: What are Shared Spaces?
content: Shared Spaces is a new and easy way for N26 users to share money together. These spaces can be used for anything from splitting bills, to planning a vacation or organising a birthday gift for a friend or relative.Shared Spaces are available to N26 premium users (You / Business You / Metal), who can both create Shared Spaces and invite participants to their Space. Participants can be any N26 account holder regardless of their account type.The owner of the Shared Space owns the money inside it.The owner can invite up to 10 participants and remove participants for their space.Similar to regular Spaces, Shared Spaces have neither an IBAN nor a card attached to them.

title: How to create a Shared Space?
content:
To create a Shared Space:Create a Space and tap it in the Spaces overview.
Tap the + icon in the top right-hand corner of the page.
Read the ‘Learn more’ information and tap the ‘Invite new member’ button.
Search and select the contact list for the N26 user you wish to invite. If the person you want to invite has an N26 account but doesn't show up in the contact list, we recommend that you ask them to check if they agreed to be visible to others N26 users via the app, in the My Account section > Settings > Personal Setting > Personal Information.
If needed, enter their full name as we have it listed.
Review the information on the Grant power of attorney page (the legal screen). Once you’ve read and agreed to the T&Cs, tick the box and tap the ‘Accept power of attorney’ button.
Enter your Confirmation PIN.
Tap on the relevant participant in the list of participants.
Confirm the ‘Send Invite’ push notification on your paired mobile device.
Learn moreWhat are Shared Spaces

title: How to add or remove Shared Space participants?
content: For an owner to remove a participant from a Shared Space:In the Space overview, tap the menu indicated by the 3 dots in the top right.From the ‘Participants’ list, tap on the arrow to the right of the relevant participant’s name (iOS). Android users can just simply tap on the participant's name.Tap ‘revoke power of attorney’. Confirm the notification on the next screen and tap ‘revoke power of attorney’. Accept an invitation and join a Shared Space:In the Spaces overview, tap the Space with ‘Pending’ and the Shared Space icon. Read the Shared Space summary and continue to the Power of Attorney screen.Once you’ve read and understood the information on the Power of Attorney page (the legal screen), tick the box and tap the ‘Accept power of attorney’ button.Enter your Confirmation PIN.Confirm the ‘Accept Power of Attorney’ push notification on your paired mobile deviceYou’ll need to have enough free Space(s) to accept an invitation to a Shared Space. If not, you can only proceed if you delete other Space(s) to free up … Space.You must also not have any open Space with the same name or image as the Shared Space. You can only accept the invitation to join a Shared Space once you change the name/image of the other Space(s).To leave a Shared Space:In the Space overview, tap the menu indicated by the 3 dots in the top right.Inside the settings tap on ‘Exit Shared Space’.Confirm the notification on the next screen and tap ‘Leave the Space’.A Shared Space can be created and modified within the N26 app or WebappLearn moreWhat are Shared Spaces

title: Shared Spaces - What is a power of attorney?
content: The legal model behind Shared Spaces is called Power of Attorney (Kontovollmacht in German). Participants of a Shared Space do not have equal ownership of the account like a joint account in the traditional banking sense. After receiving Power of Attorney the participants obtain the right to act on behalf of the Owner regarding any transfer of funds within the Shared Space.The person authorizing the other to act on his behalf is called the “Owner”, this person is the only account holder. The owner must be a N26 premium account holder e.g. N26 You, N26 Metal and N26 Business You.This means that whoever created the Shared Space is its legal owner. The owner of a Shared Space: Owns all the funds within a Shared Space. Can transfer funds freely in and out of the account anytime. Can invite people to the Shared Space by granting others Power of Attorney.Can revoke the Power of Attorney of a participant at any time.Can also close a Shared Space after removing a participant. (all funds in the Shared Space will be transferred to the Owner’s Main Account)By granting a person Power of Attorney, they’ll have full access to all the money held within a Shared Space. This means that each participant can also transfer funds freely in and out of the Shared Space. N26 Bank GmbH cannot be held liable for payments covered by the Power of Attorney.Learn moreWhat are Shared Spaces

title: How to use Apple Pay?
content:
(Applies to Germany, Austria, France, Italy, Spain, Finland, Ireland, Iceland, Greece, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Portugal, Slovakia, Estonia, Belgium, Poland, Norway, Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, and Switzerland)Apple Pay allows you to make payments with your smartphone so you don’t have to carry your Mastercard everywhere.We’ve made a video(new tab) to help you set up your N26 Mastercard with Apple Pay.Some tips to keep in mind:Your iPhone region matches the country where your Mastercard was first shipped to (you can check your region by selecting Settings then General and Language & Region in your phone).
If you’ve lost your iPhone and aren’t able to find it again using Find My iPhone, you can always access your iCloud and remove all Apple Pay devices via the web browser on a Mac or PC. In addition, you should turn on Lost Mode to block your Mastercard for Apple Pay. Payments with your physical card will still be possible.
If your N26 Mastercard is unexpectedly removed from Apple Wallet, it may be because you have logged out of your iCloud, turned off Passcode or Touch ID, reset your device to factory settings via iTunes, or deleted all the content and settings from your device. In all cases, you can simply add your card again. Keep in mind that the card won’t be removed if you update your operating system, reset your personal device settings, or turn off Find My iPhone.
For in-store or online purchases, you must authorize your payment via Touch ID or using your passcode. If you’re using Apple Watch, authorizations are done by double-clicking on the side button. And if you’re using your Mac, authorize your payment by using Touch ID via the Touch Bar in the top-right corner of your keyboard.
If you're an N26 Metal or N26 Business You customer, it may happen that the card image displayed in your Apple Wallet shows as an N26 You card (for Metal customers) or as an N26 Business card (for Business You customers). We're working now to resolve this. Rest assured that this does not affect the usability of Apple Pay or your premium membership.
Make sure your device meets the technical requirements by visiting Apple Support(new tab):iPhone 6 or later, iPhone SE: available in apps, stores and webApple Watch paired with iPhone 5 or later: available in apps and storesiPad Pro, iPad Air 2, iPad mini 3, iPad mini 4: available in apps and webMacs introduced in 2012 or later (Macs other than the MacBook Pro with Touch Bar and Touch ID require an iPhone or Apple Watch: available in web

title: How to use Google Pay?
content: Applies to Germany, Spain, Italy, Ireland, Belgium, Slovakia, France, Denmark, Finland, Sweden, Norway, Poland and Switzerland. Google Pay is a payment method that allows you to pay with your smartphone so you don’t have to carry your Mastercard with you all the time.Google Pay is available in all shops supporting contactless (NFC) payments as well as online shops. Hold your smartphone near the contactless terminal and your payment will automatically process. When paying online, select Google Pay as the payment option. We’ll ask you to confirm your payment via push message during checkout.Some tips to keep in mind:To add your N26 Mastercard, download the Google Pay app and select Get Started to enter your card details. You’ll need Android 5.0 (Lollipop) or higher as well as an NFC-capable smartphone.Google Pay requires a screen lock. If you didn’t set it up yet, you’ll be asked to before adding your Mastercard to the Google Pay app.If you’re protecting your smartphone with a case, you might have to remove it to pay. Some payment terminals don’t recognize your phone if the case is too big.If the payment terminal asks you to present your card (again), you might have removed the smartphone too fast or didn’t hold it close enough. Just try again while keeping this in mind.

title: How to invite friends to join N26?
content: You can start inviting friends as soon as you have access to your account, in the mobile app or N26 WebApp.(new tab) To invite friends:on iOS:Log into the mobile app and tap on the Explore tab next to the + button.Tap on Refer friends.Tap on your Referral Code to copy it.Select one of the options available for sharing. Write a message to your friend or use the default then tap Send.on Android:Log into the mobile app, then go to My Account 👤 and select the gift icon.Tap on your Referral Code to copy it.Tap Tell a friend.Select one of the options available for sharing.Write a message to your friend or use the default then tap Send.Find out how you can be rewarded for your referrals with our Refer a Friend Program (available in select countries).

title: How to earn money by inviting friends to N26?
content: You can start inviting friends as soon as you have access to your account (in the app or the Web app(new tab)).To know the amount you can get per referral, simply access the Refer friends section:Log into the N26 app.From the Home screen, go to the Explore tab (mobile app) or My account 👤 (N26 Web app).Select Refer friends.Tap on your Referral Code to copy it and select one of the options available for sharing.Optionally, you can write a message to your friend or use the default. Tap Send!To receive your reward your friend must meet all our requirements:Complete their sign up using your referral link or personal code.Activate their Mastercard.Complete a first Mastercard transaction worth at least the value of the referral reward (in-store, online or ATM).Once your friend has fulfilled the requirements, you'll receive the bonus within 60 days. You can check the status of your referral bonus in the mobile app or N26 Web.In total,  you can get up to €1500 out of referrals.If your referral bonus hasn’t arrived yet, we’ve also collected a few reasons why.*The link does not expire and it can be used at any time. Personal invite codes and links should only be used for personal and non-commercial purposes. This means you can share your invite link with your personal connections via social media as long as you are the primary content owner. N26 has the right to cancel the referral program at any time.Currently, Friend referral rewards are only available for customers in Germany, Austria, Italy, France, Spain, Belgium, Luxembourg, Greece, Portugal, Ireland, the Netherlands, Finland, Estonia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Switzerland, Norway, Denmark, Poland, Iceland and Liechtenstein.You can find more information in the Refer a Friend Program T&Cs(new tab).

title: Why hasn't my referral bonus arrived?
content: Once your friend has completed all the eligibility criteria of our Refer a Friend Program, we'll verify your reward. You can always sign in to your account in the app or WebApp(new tab) to check your reward status.In most cases the referral bonus isn’t rewarded because the invited friend hasn’t made a first Mastercard transaction of 15 EUR. Please make sure to inform your friend of these requirements.Keep in mind that the reward process could take up to 60 days.N26 retains the right to withhold a reward in case of suspicious activity that violates the Terms and Conditions(new tab).Currently, Friend referral rewards are only available for customers in Germany, Austria, Italy, France, Spain, Belgium, Luxembourg, Greece, Portugal, Ireland, the Netherlands, Finland, Estonia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Switzerland, Norway, Denmark, Poland, Iceland and Liechtenstein.

title: Why are some products and services unavailable to me?
content: We collaborate with many partners. That’s why certain products and services require that you meet their requirements as well. The most common reasons why you wouldn’t be eligible for certain products:Expired or unsupported identity documents (for example, certain passports due to a lack of security features).You’re taxable in the United States. If so, you won’t be able to use certain invest or savings products. If this is not the case, contact our Customer Support via chat so we can look into your account details. You may need to switch your telephone number if it starts with a North American area code (+1).You proved your identity using PostIdent (in Germany). We’ll have to reset your account and you’ll have to prove your identity again in order to use certain products and services. If this is the case, we’ll email you about it and find a convenient time for you to do so.The product or service is not yet available in your country.

title: How to give feedback or suggest a new product?
content: We frequently send short surveys to review feedback but participation is voluntary and anonymous. For individual questions or suggestions, you can send us your feedback to ideas@n26.com(new tab). We’re always grateful if you can take a minute or two to help us get even better.And if you ever feel dissatisfied with one of our products or services, you can also file a complaint.

title: How to get push messages?
content: We send you push messages to finalize transfers (such as MoneyBeam) or to confirm a service (as with CASH26- please note this is only available in Germany, Austria, Italy). If you aren’t receiving these messages, first check that notifications are enabled for both your phone and the app. Then try some of our troubleshooting suggestions, depending on your smartphone:iOS:Delete the app and restart your smartphone. Download and install the latest version of the app from the Apple App Store and connect your smartphone again.Check whether you’re logged into your N26 app.Make sure messaging for the app has been activated in the general settings of your smartphone.Android:Delete the app and restart your smartphone. Download and install the latest version of the app from the Google Play Store and connect your smartphone again.Go to your Account settings and activate notification by tapping App settings then Notifications.Huawei and Xiaomi: go to Settings then Advanced settings and Battery settings. Then set N26 as a protected app.OnePlus: select battery optimization then the N26 app and then don't optimize.Oppo: disable battery optimization for the app and lock it in the Recent apps overview.

title: How to manage my visibility as an N26 user?
content: To grant you access to all our in-app features, N26 matches your contact data with other N26 users.In order to manage your consent to be seen as a N26 user, you can simply go to 👤 My Account in the app and selecting Settings then Personal Settings and Personal information. Then just check or uncheck the box “I agree to be identifiable for other users as N26 customer”.All of your contacts who have an N26 account set to visible will show up in the in-app contact list. Similarly, you’ll also appear in the list of other N26 customers who have your contact information. Your contact list is not permanently stored by N26 and is only used when accessing the respective N26 feature.Why do I need to be visible to other N26 users

title: Can I download the N26 app on my smartphone?
content: You can check and download the last version of the N26 app from the Apple App Store(new tab) or the Google Play Store(new tab).The minimum requirements for iPhones  (you can find your iOS version under Settings > General > Info):Model 5s or neweriOS 11 or aboveThe minimum requirements for Android (you can find your Android version under Settings > About your device):Android 6.0. or above Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to contact N26?
content:
If you want to reach out, you can open a chat with us directly within the mobile or WebApp, or from certain Support Center(new tab) articles. As an online bank we don't have branches.First of all, make sure you're up-to-date with the newest version of the app. If not, update your app in the Apple App Store(new tab) or the Google Play Store(new tab).When accessing your account from our WebApp(new tab), you can find the chat in the bottom right corner. 

Or from your paired smartphone, go to 👤 My Account then Support. Then scroll down and tap Support chat under Get in touch. 

You’ll then see your place in the queue. Keep your Mastercard close by, it's optional but you'll get faster service.Our chat is available everyday from 07:00-23:00 including Sundays and bank holidays.Please visit this article if you represent a bank or an authority and need to contact N26(new tab).

title: ¿Puedo abrir una cuenta N26 en mi país?
content: Ofrecemos cuentas por todo el mundo: en España, Alemania, Austria, Francia, Italia, Irlanda, los Países Bajos, Bélgica, Dinamarca, Eslovaquia, Eslovenia, Estonia, Finlandia, Grecia, Islandia, Liechtenstein, Luxemburgo, Noruega, Polonia, Portugal, Suecia, Suiza y los Estados Unidos.Puedes abrir tu cuenta si vives en uno de estos países y cumples con nuestros requisitos. Nuestros productos y servicios varían dependiendo del país. Si ya tienes una cuenta abierta y te mudas a un país en el que N26 no está disponible durante 18 meses o más, contacta con atención al cliente. ¿Quieres ganar dinero hablando de nosotros a tus amigos

title: ¿Puedo abrir una cuenta si vivo fuera de la zona euro?
content: Si vives en Dinamarca, Islandia, Liechtenstein, Noruega, Polonia, Suecia o Suiza tienes la posibilidad de abrir una cuenta con nosotros. Te ofrecemos: La opción de elegir entre una cuenta N26 Estándar o N26 Business. Una cuenta en euros, un IBAN alemán, transferencias SEPA o Moneybeam.Conversión de moneda con la tarjeta de débito Mastercard. Servicio de atención al cliente en inglés Envío gratuito de la primera tarjeta Mastercard o envío exprés por 25€.Transferencias a otras divisas con TransferWise. (Para cuentas Estándar).5 retiradas gratuitas en la zona euro (1.7% de comisión para retiradas en otra divisa.)0.1% de reembolso de tus pagos con tarjeta (con la cuenta Business).2 espacios además de la cuenta principal. Un bonus por cada amigo que se abre la cuenta con tu invitación de nuestra promoción ''Invita a un amigo''.Pagos ''sin contacto'' utilizando Google Pay y Apple Pay.Consejos para las transferencias entrantes y salientes:Te recomendamos escoger tu divisa local para obtener la mejor tasa de cambio en los pagos con tu tarjeta Mastercard o en retiradas de efectivo (en caso contrario se pueden aplicar alguna comisión). Para recargar tu cuenta con tu moneda local, te recomendamos convertirla utilizando TransferWise (desde la app o su website(pestaña nueva).), o a través de tu banco local. Para enviar transferencias a cuenta en Euros, usa la app para hacer una transferencia SEPA. Para cuentas que nos son en euros, utiliza TransferWise desde la app.**Ten en cuenta que TransferWise no está disponible para cuentas N26 Business (solo es posible realizar transferencias SEPA en euros.)

title: ¿Cómo abrir una cuenta en N26?
content:
Puedes abrir una cuenta en N26 desde la app (en tu smartphone) o la Web App(pestaña nueva) siempre y cuando:tengas al menos 18 años.residas en un país en el que operamos.tengas un smartphone compatible.tengas un documento de identidad aceptado (depende de si vives en España(pestaña nueva), en Alemania(pestaña nueva) o en otro país(pestaña nueva)).cuentes con un número de identificación fiscal, según el art. 202 de la Ley General Tributaria 58/2003.no tengas ya una cuenta con nosotros.seas capaz de verificar tu identidad en uno de los idiomas en los que operamos: español, inglés, francés, italiano y alemán.
Así funciona el proceso de registro para una cuenta bancaria N26:Después de confirmar tu email, tu información personal y tu dirección de envío, elige el tipo de cuenta* que quieres.Verifica tu identidad y conecta tu smartphone con tu nueva cuenta. Al ser un nuevo registro, puedes ingresar dinero en tu cuenta directamente desde la app a través de una transferencia bancaria. Solo tendrás que indicar los datos bancarios de tu otra cuenta y elegir la cantidad que quieres depositar entre 5 € y 150 €. Después de esta primera vez, puedes transferir dinero a tu cuenta N26 mediante una transferencia SEPA.Al cabo de unos días recibirás tu Mastercard N26 por correo postal.Si quieres más información, sigue este enlace para contactar con nosotros.
*Si cumples todos los requisitos, puedes abrir tu cuenta bancaria N26. Si no cumples con los requisitos mínimos, podemos ofrecerte una cuenta N26 Flex (solo en Alemania). Esta decisión se calcula a través de un proceso automático.Nuestro chat de atención de al cliente está disponible de 7:00 a 23:00 todos los días, incluyendo domingos y festivos. ¿Quieres ganar dinero hablando de nosotros a tus amigos

title: ¿Por qué no funciona mi verificación por vídeo?
content: Consejos para que la verificación por vídeo salga bien:La mayoría de las videollamadas fallan, o bien por mala conexión a internet, o bien por la mala calidad de la imagen (aparece una imagen borrosa o no hay demasiada luz, por ejemplo). Realiza la videollamada en un ambiente claro y apropiado, utiliza un móvil con buena cámara y asegúrate de tener buena conexión a internet.Asegúrate de ser la única persona que aparece en la videollamada.Debes vivir en uno de los países donde prestamos servicio para poder abrir una cuenta con nosotros.Solo aceptamos documentos de identificación nacionales (los permisos de residencia o las licencias para conducir no valen). Además, el documento no puede estar dañado ni caducado.Una vez que el proceso de verificación esté completo, te enviaremos tu Mastercard N26. La entrega puede tardar hasta 14 días, o hasta 30 días si vives en alguna de las islas de España, en Ceuta o en Melilla.Nuestras líneas están abiertas todos los días de 07:00 a 23:00, domingos y festivos incluidos.

title: ¿Cómo verificar mi identidad?
content: Como banco, necesitamos saber quién eres. Por ello necesitas demostrar tu identidad mediante un pasaporte o un carnet de identidad cuando te das de alta o al usar ciertos productos.Nunca te pediremos que verifiques tu identidad a nombre de otras personas o empresas. Aquí tenemos una recopilación de consejos para ayudarte a proteger tu identidad.Puedes verificar tu identidad de dos formas diferentes y hemos recopilado algunos consejos para cada una de ellas: foto y vídeo. El método con el que demuestras tu identidad depende de tu nacionalidad, de tu país de residencia y del tipo de documento que utilices:Vivo en España(pestaña nueva)Vivo en Alemania(pestaña nueva)Vivo en otro país(pestaña nueva)Si tu pasaporte o tu carnet de identidad no están en nuestra lista, quiere decir que no podemos ofrecerte una cuenta por el momento. Nos tomamos la verificación de la identidad muy en serio. Si tu documento de identidad no está en nuestras listas, nuestro Servicio de Atención al Cliente no podrá hacer una excepción por ti.De todas formas, estamos añadiendo documentos a esta lista constantemente, de modo que merece la pena comprobar de vez en cuando si se ha añadido el tuyo.El chat está disponible todos los días de 07:00 a 23:00, domingos y festivos incluidos.

title: ¿Por qué no funciona mi verificación por foto?
content: ℹ️ Válido en todas las regiones excepto AlemaniaPrimero asegúrate de tener activada la geolocalización y luego revisa esta guía(pestaña nueva) para ayudarte a tomar las mejores fotos.La mayoría de las verificaciones por foto fallan debido a una mala calidad de imagen.Completa el proceso en un entorno con luz y con un teléfono con buena cámara.Si estas utilizando un dispositivo Android, asegúrate de tener un buen enfoque automático.Enciende o apaga el flash en función de la luz que haya a tu alrededor.Sácate el selfie como una foto de pasaporte (la cámara debe estar al mismo nivel que tus ojos).Asegúrate de ser la única persona que aparece en la foto.Comprueba tu documento.Solo aceptamos fotos de tu documento de identidad original (las fotocopias no están permitidas).Coloca tu documento en una superficie plana y asegúrate de que todos los datos estén visibles y legibles.Solo aceptamos documentos de identificación nacionales (los permisos de residencia o las licencias para conducir no valen).El documento no puede estar dañado ni caducado.Si te sacas un selfie y una foto a tu documentación y al primer intento no sale bien, puedes volver a probar.Una vez que el proceso de verificación esté completado, te enviaremos tu tarjeta MasterCard de N26. La entrega puede tardar hasta 10 días, o hasta 30 días si vives en alguna de las islas de España, en Ceuta o en Melilla.El chat está disponible todos los días de 07:00 a 23:00, domingos y festivos incluidos.

title: ¿Cómo declarar mi cuenta N26 para los impuestos en Francia?
content: (aplica a los residentes en Francia)De acuerdo con el Código de Impuesto General Francés, todos los residentes franceses estarán obligados a declarar cualquier cuenta bancaria que hayan abierto, usado o cerrado el último año sobre el año en el que hayan recibido ingresos, esto incluye tu cuenta en N26. Para hacerlo:En tu declaración de impuestos, marca la casilla de Cuenta Extranjera abierta, usada o cerrada (8UU) (Compte étranger ouvert, utilisé ou fermé).Completa el formulario Cerfa n° 3916(pestaña nueva) y añádelo a tu declaración de impuestos.

title: ¿Qué hace N26 con mi información fiscal?
content: La OCDE (Organización para la Cooperación y el Desarrollo Económicos) requiere cierta información fiscal que ha de ser compartida por medio del Estándar Común de Reporte(pestaña nueva) (ECR). Para cumplir esta obligación, debemos establecer en qué país estás sujeto a impuestos. Lo hacemos mediante tu número de información fiscal o seguridad social.Reenviamos toda esta información mediante la oficina Federal de Impuestos de Alemania a las autoridades fiscales de otros países si:Vives en un país integrado en el ECR (Estándar Común de Reporte).Tienes una dirección postal o una segunda dirección en otro país integrado en el ECR.Al registrarte proporcionaste un número de teléfono perteneciente a un país no integrado en el ECR.Tienes una transferencia programada o haces pagos frecuentes a una cuenta en otro país integrado en el ECR.También enviamos datos al IRS (Internal Revenue Service)(pestaña nueva) de los Estados Unidos, de acuerdo con FATCA (Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act)(pestaña nueva). Puede que te pidamos el número de la Seguridad Social para verificar tu estado fiscal en Estados Unidos, en los siguientes escenarios:Eres ciudadano de los Estados Unidos (incluidas las personas con doble nacionalidad).Al registrarte proporcionaste un número de teléfono de los Estados Unidos.Naciste en los Estados Unidos (o en una embajada de los Estados Unidos en el extranjero).Te has casado con una persona de nacionalidad estadounidense.Has facilitado una dirección en Estados Unidos.Realizas pagos regulares a los Estados Unidos.Para actualizar tu información fiscal o el número de la seguridad social en la app N26:Ve a 👤 Mi cuenta > Configuraciones y pulsa en Configuración Personal.Selecciona Configuración personal y luego Información de Impuestos.Elige el país en el que estás sujeto a pagar impuestos.Introduce tu número de identificación fiscal o tu número de la Seguridad Social.Información importanteEn Alemania necesitamos tu Steueridentifikationsnummer de 11 dígitos, no el Steuernummer de 9 dígitos.Si no estás sujeto a pagar impuestos en otro país, contacta con nosotros para que podamos comprobarlo.En todos y cada uno de los casos, tu información personal se mantendrá almacenada de forma segura y será utilizada únicamente para cumplir con los requisitos del ECR y FATCA.No estamos capacitados para asesorarte en tu estado fiscal. Si estás inseguro, háblalo con un asesor de impuestos.Si ingresaste el país en el que estás sujeto a impuestos pero no tu número de identificación fiscal, elimina el país de la lista que se muestra en la app, vuelve a seleccionar el país e ingresa de nuevo tu número de identificación fiscal.

title: ¿Cómo puedo hacer de N26 mi cuenta principal?
content: Podemos ayudarte a convertir N26 en tu cuenta principal moviendo tus movimientos cotidianos desde otra cuenta: informaremos a cada entidad en donde tengas pagos domiciliados (como suscripciones mensuales o facturas) o a quien transfiera dinero a tu cuenta (como algún empleado), y les explicaremos cómo configurar las órdenes permanentes o bien cómo transferir los fondos restantes. Lee a continuación como hacer de N26 tu cuenta principal:Servicio de cambio de cuenta ofrecido por finleapJunto a nuestro socio finleap estamos ofreciéndote una plataforma para, que de forma fácil y online, puedas cambiar de cuenta. Es un proceso automático y completamente gratuito.Utiliza nuestro formulario(pestaña nueva) e inicia sesión con los datos de tu cuenta bancaria anterior. Cuando rellenes todos los campos, tardaremos entre 5 y 7 días laborales en enviar todas las cartas de notificación respectivamente. Puede que los comercios o empresas asociadas necesiten más tiempo para modificar tus datos y así cambiar las futuras transacciones.

title: ¿Cómo cerrar mi cuenta?
content: Lamentamos que quieras cerrar tu cuenta, pero apreciamos el tiempo que has estado con nosotros como cliente. Puedes elegir entre estas dos opciones para cancelar tu cuenta N26:Opción 1: haz clic aquí(pestaña nueva) para seguir los pasos a través de nuestro proceso electrónico de cierre de cuenta.Esta opción es la forma más rápida de cerrar tu cuenta.Debes iniciar sesión para verificar tu identidad.Serás guiado a través del proceso para cerrar tu cuenta.Si no puedes iniciar sesión o no deseas hacerlo, sigue los pasos de la Opción 2.Opción 2: Necesitamos que contactes con nosotros por chat o por correo electrónico(pestaña nueva) a closure@n26.com(pestaña nueva) desde tu dirección de correo electrónico registrada utilizando nuestro formulario de cancelación(pestaña nueva) (el formulario requerirá la siguiente información):La declaración donde solicitas el cierre de tu cuenta en una fecha determinada o «lo antes posible».Tu nombre.Tu IBAN de N26.Un IBAN diferente dentro de la zona SEPA (Euro) para transferir tu saldo restante en caso de que sea positivo o de que tengas fondos en Espacios que no has transferido a tu cuenta principal.Cosas a tener en cuenta antes de cerrar tu cuenta:Para que vaya más rápido: si tienes saldo positivo, por favor, transfiere el saldo restante tú mismo. Si tienes saldo negativo, transfiere dinero a la cuenta para dejar el balance a cero.Destruye tus tarjetas cortándolas por ejemplo con unas tijeras. Se debe cortar el chip, la antena NFC y la banda magnética y después deshacerse de los trozos por separado.

title: ¿Cómo saber cuál es mi IBAN o número de cuenta?
content: Puedes encontrar tu IBAN y tu número BIC en los extractos de tu cuenta o en el apartado 👤 Mi cuenta en la app o WebApp(pestaña nueva) (en caso de que no hayas activado tu tarjeta y necesites ingresar dinero en tu cuenta).Puedes compartir la información de forma sencilla haciendo clic en el botón de compartir que encontrarás en 👤 Mi cuenta. También puedes descargar en formato PDF la información bancaria. Para hacerlo, entra a tu cuenta desde la WebApp(pestaña nueva) y haz clic en el icono de la nube en la esquina superior derecha de las Transacciones.Todos nuestros códigos IBAN españoles empiezan por ES seguido de un código de control de 2 dígitos, luego nuestro código de entidad financiera 1563 2626, después 2 dígitos de control y, por último, tu número de cuenta de 10 dígitos.Nuestro IBAN alemán, en cambio, empieza por DE seguido de un código de control de 2 dígitos, luego nuestro código de entidad financiera 10011001 y terminan con tu número de cuenta de 10 dígitos (empieza por 26).Si tienes tu dispositivo vinculado y una tarjeta activa, ahora puedes ver toda la información de tu tarjeta desde tu app N26, permitiéndote realizar pagos por internet sin la necesidad de tener tu tarjeta física N26 MasterCard contigo. Para esto, simplemente sigue las instrucciones a continuación:Ve a Gestionar y pulsa en 'Configuración de la tarjeta', busca tu tarjeta activa y haz clic en 'Detalles de la tarjeta'Usa tu reconocimiento dactilar, facial o PIN de desbloqueo del teléfono para mostrar los detalles completos de su tarjetaLa pantalla estará disponible durante 1 minuto.

title: ¿Cómo descargar mi información personal?
content: La Regulación General de Protección de Datos (RGPD) es una nueva regulación europea sobre la protección de datos y la privacidad que entró en vigor el 25 de mayo de 2018. Como respuesta a esta ley, hemos añadido la opción de exportar tu información en la Web App(pestaña nueva): entra en 👤 Mi Cuenta, después en Configuración Personal y finalmente haz clic en Tus datos personales.Como banco móvil que somos, entendemos la importancia de la seguridad de los datos. Debes saber que almacenamos el mínimo de datos posibles, solo aquellos que estamos obligados a tener por ley. Además, eliminamos los datos una vez que dejan de ser necesarios para nuestros productos o servicios.El artículo 20 de la RGPD afirma que tienes derecho a la portabilidad de tus datos y te permite cambiar de proveedor de servicios en caso de que quieras abrir una cuenta bancaria con otro banco. Por ello y de acuerdo con este artículo tenemos que enviarte estos datos en un formato legible por máquina. Ten en cuenta que este archivo está destinado a la portabilidad de datos y puede que tu ordenador no pueda leer archivos en formato JSON. En caso de que puedas abrir el archivo, es posible que sea difícil de entender ya que no está pensando para que las personas lo puedan comprender, si no una máquina. Como somos un banco online, entendemos la importancia de la protección de datos. Por ello, tomamos medidas de seguridad extra antes de que puedas descargar tus datos. Hacemos esto para asegurarnos de que el titular de la cuenta es la persona que está solicitando los datos.Cómo descargar tus datosPuedes solicitar la descarga de datos personales tanto de tu cuenta actual como de una cuenta que hayas cerrado en los últimos 6 meses. La información viene en un formato de lectura electrónica para que puedas compartirla con terceros si lo deseas.Clientes actualesPor favor inicie sesión en esta página(pestaña nueva) utilizando la misma información de acceso a su cuenta de N26.Tendrás que crear una contraseña temporal para cuando te enviemos el documento a tu email. Este link estará activo 24 horas desde que recibes el email. Recuerda que si la contraseña se introduce erróneamente 5 veces, el link caducará y tendrás que realizar otra solicitud.Antiguos clientesSolo podrás descargar tus datos si has cerrado tu cuenta en los últimos 6 meses. Para solicitar esta información completa el formulario(pestaña nueva) y asegúrate de que los datos coinciden con los de tu antigua cuenta. Necesitarás:nombre, apellido, número de identidad y fecha de expiración del documento que proporcionaste al abrir la cuenta (DNI o pasaporte)email registrado en tu cuentafecha (mes y año) en la que creaste y cerraste la cuenta (revisa el email que recibiste al confirmar tu dirección de correo electrónico en el proceso de registro)Por motivos de seguridad, tenemos que asegurarnos de que realmente eres tú quien está descargando los datos; si algún campo está incorrecto o incompleto, tu petición no será aceptada.Tendrás que crear una contraseña temporal para cuando te enviemos el documento a tu email. Este link estará activo 24 horas desde que recibes el email. Recuerda que si la contraseña se introduce erróneamente 5 veces, el link caducará y tendrás que realizar otra solicitud.Si quieres más información sobre la recopilación, el uso y el procesamiento de tus datos personales, visita nuestra Política de Privacidad(pestaña nueva).

title: ¿Cómo cambiar mi dirección, número de teléfono u otra información personal?
content: Es esencial mantener tu información personal actualizada. Por ejemplo, tener tu número de teléfono actualizado es necesario para vincular tu móvil(pestaña nueva) o para enviar y recibir un MoneyBeam(pestaña nueva). Así es como se hace:Dirección de envío, contraseña e información de impuestos: Modifica esta información cuando quieras desde la app N26. Ve a 👤 Mi Cuenta, selecciona Configuración y luego Configuración personal.Nombre y sexo: Contáctanos por chat y envíanos 2 documentos nacionales de identidad: una copia de tu DNI o pasaporte junto con un documento oficial del cambio (licencia matrimonial o un certificado de nacimiento actualizado).Nacionalidad: Contáctanos por chat y envíanos una copia de tu DNI o pasaporte.Email: Necesitarás contactarnos por chat. Tenemos que verificar que eres realmente tú, por lo que no podemos hacerlo vía email.Número de teléfono Puedes modificar esta información cuando quieras desde la app N26. Ve a 👤 Mi Cuenta, selecciona Configuración y luego Configuración personal.Para actualizar tu número de teléfono necesitas hacerlo desde el smartphone vinculado a tu cuenta.

title: ¿Qué es “Mensajes de N26”?
content: La seguridad de tus datos personales es nuestra prioridad, por ello, hemos creado un buzón dentro de la app que te va a permitir compartir cualquier comunicación. Cualquier contenido que incluya datos personales lo vamos a comunicar a través de Mensajes de N26. De todas formas, seguiremos comunicando a tu email la información general. ¿Qué son los datos personales

title: ¿Cómo presentar una reclamación?
content:
Si necesitas soporte técnico o tienes alguna preguntaSi no quieres presentar una reclamación, pero tienes alguna pregunta sobre nuestros productos o necesitas ayuda con tu cuenta, estamos siempre encantados de atenderte. Puedes enviarnos un email a support@n26.com(pestaña nueva) (nueva pestaña) o abrir un chat para hablar con nosotros directamente en la app móvil o la WebApp, que es la forma más rápida y sencilla de contactar con nosotros. Cómo presentar una reclamaciónSentimos mucho que te veas obligado/a presentar una reclamación; a continuación, te explicamos cómo hacerlo. Si no estás satisfecho/a con uno de nuestros productos o servicios, puedes enviarnos un email desde la dirección de email con la que te registraste* o enviarnos una reclamación por correo postal a la siguiente dirección: N26 Bank GmbH – Complaint Management
Klosterstraße 62, 10179 Berlín, Alemania  Para enviar tu reclamación por email, escríbenos a la siguiente dirección de email: reclamaciones.es@n26.com(pestaña nueva) (nueva pestaña).Si tienes un IBAN alemán (DE), escríbenos a reclamaciones@n26.com(pestaña nueva) (nueva pestaña). 

Otra forma de presentar una reclamación es a través de nuestro equipo de soporte en tiempo real, que estará encantado de atenderte. Cuando presentes una reclamación, indica siempre lo siguiente:●     Tu nombre completo, email y dirección
●     El producto o servicio con el que no estás satisfecho/a
●     Una descripción de tu reclamación y cuándo se ha producido la incidencia.
●     También puedes incluir documentación adicional relativa a tu reclamación, de haberla Te enviaremos un email para confirmarte que hemos recibido tu reclamación e iniciado la investigación. Si necesitamos que nos proporciones más información, nuestro Departamento de Tramitación de Reclamaciones se pondrá en contacto contigo directamente por email y te proporcionará toda la información que necesites.En cuanto nuestro Departamento de Tramitación de Reclamaciones haya investigado tus quejas, te enviará su decisión definitiva por email. Tenemos un mes para resolver las reclamaciones de los clientes españoles. Si la reclamación está relacionada con una disputa relativa a servicios de pago, tendremos 15 días para resolver tu reclamación.  Si no quedas satisfecho/a con el resultado de tu reclamación
Si no te ha satisfecho nuestra resolución, puedes elevar tu reclamación a un organismo independiente externo.

Por ejemplo:Puedes elevar tu reclamación al Banco de España – Departamento de Conducta de Mercado y Reclamaciones, ubicado en la Calle Alcalá 48, 28014 Madrid.
Los clientes con IBAN alemán (DE) que no estén satisfechos con la respuesta a la reclamación también pueden ponerse en contacto con uno de los siguientes organismos de arbitraje.

Por ejemplo:Uno de los organismos de arbitraje que tienes a tu disposición es el Banco Federal alemán (Deutsche Bundesbank) También puedes elevar tu reclamación a la Autoridad Federal de Supervisión Financiera alemana (Bundesanstalt für Finanzdienstleistungsaufsicht – BaFin) La Comisión Europea también proporciona una plataforma de Resolución de Litigios en Línea para ayudar a los consumidores a resolver disputas de manera extrajudicial.  Nuestro compromiso es mejorar nuestros productos y servicios constantemente, y tu opinión lo hace posible. Si quieres hacernos llegar tus opiniones sobre cualquier tema, envíanos un email a ideas@n26.com(pestaña nueva) (nueva pestaña).* Solo podemos tratar los asuntos relacionados con una cuenta si nos escribes desde la dirección de email registrada con la cuenta N26

title: ¿Cómo obtener una Basiskonto?
content: Descárgate la solicitud(pestaña nueva), rellénala y fírmala a mano.Coge el formulario y el cupón de PostIdent adjunto, luego llévalo a la sucursal más cercana de Deutsche Post para verificar tu identidad.Una vez que recibamos tu solicitud y decidamos si podemos abrirte una Basiskonto, te enviaremos un email incluyendo el contrato con los Términos y Condiciones(pestaña nueva) de uso.Envia tu contrato firmado a Klosterstraße 62, 10179 Berlin.Una vez que recibamos tu contrato, abriremos tu cuenta en los próximos 10 días laborables.Recibirás una notificación con el envío de tu tarjeta para que accedas a tu cuenta.

title: ¿Por qué no puedo tener una Basiskonto?
content: Bajo ciertas circunstancias, N26 puede rechazar tu solicitud de Basiskonto.
